title: Aurobindo Pharma clarifies, reports of Zentiva buyout 'premature', no binding agreement yet
content: Aurobindo Pharma, a leading player in the active pharmaceutical ingredient and generic market, has issued a statement clarifying that reports of buying out Prague-based generic drugmaker Zentiva are 'premature', and no binding agreement has been made by company, according to a company filing issued on August 20. Earlier today, The Economic Times had reported citing people familiar with the development that the pharma company is the frontrunner to acquire Zentiva from Advent International for $5-5.5 billion, or Rs 43,500-47,900 crore. The shares of Aurobindo Pharma recovered from early lows soon after the statement was made public, though still lower by 3 percent in the trading session. "...at present, no binding agreement or definitive decision has been made by the Board of Directors of the Company in relation to the transaction referred to in the said article(s). Accordingly, the said news item is premature and should not be relied upon," the company filing said. Aurobindo Pharma added that it 'regularly explores' various strategic opportunities, including potential acquisitions and partnerships, which can enhance shareholder value. "In the event of any definitive development requiring disclosure under the SEBI Listing Regulations, the Company will promptly make the necessary and timely announcements to the stock exchanges in accordance with applicable regulatory requirements," Aurobindo Pharma added. At the said deal valuations, this would have emerged as the biggest acquisition by an Indian pharma player anywhere in the world, larger than Sun Pharma’s acquisition of Daiichi Sankyo’s stake in Ranbaxy or Biocon Biologics’ buyout of US-based Viatris.
summary_lexrank: "...at present, no binding agreement or definitive decision has been made by the Board of Directors of the Company in relation to the transaction referred to in the said article(s).
summary_luhn: Aurobindo Pharma, a leading player in the active pharmaceutical ingredient and generic market, has issued a statement clarifying that reports of buying out Prague-based generic drugmaker Zentiva are 'premature', and no binding agreement has been made by company, according to a company filing issued on August 20.
summary_lsa: Aurobindo Pharma added that it 'regularly explores' various strategic opportunities, including potential acquisitions and partnerships, which can enhance shareholder value.
summary_textrank: "In the event of any definitive development requiring disclosure under the SEBI Listing Regulations, the Company will promptly make the necessary and timely announcements to the stock exchanges in accordance with applicable regulatory requirements," Aurobindo Pharma added.

title: KEI Industries shares rise 2.06% in Wednesday's session
content: KEI Industries shares gained 2.06% to trade at Rs 4,028 in Wednesday's session. The stock is part of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Snapshot The following tables summarize the consolidated financial performance of KEI Industries. Physical meetings are planned in Mumbai on August 20, 2025, organized by Equirus Securities Private Limited (9:00 AM to 01:00 PM) and Antique Stock Broking Limited (02:00 PM to 05:00 PM). A virtual meeting organized by Centrum Broking Limited is scheduled for August 21, 2025 (02:00 PM to 05:00 PM). Additionally, a plant visit to Silvassa/Chinchpada by analysts/investors, organized by Jefferies India Private Limited, is scheduled from 03:45 PM onwards on August 21, 2025. The company announced an interim dividend of Rs 4.00 per share (200%) on January 3, 2025, with the effective date being January 27, 2025. The company had also announced an interim dividend of Rs 3.50 per share (175%) on March 1, 2024, with the effective date being March 19, 2024. KEI Industries had a stock split on December 21, 2006, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 2. Moneycontrol analysis on August 13, 2025, indicated a neutral sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 4,028, KEI Industries has demonstrated a positive movement of 2.06% in today's session.

title: Hindustan Unilever shares among top gainers on Nifty 50, up 1.73%
content: Shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading higher in Wednesday's session. The stock is currently priced at Rs 2,649.90, a gain of 1.73% in comparison to its previous close. The schedule for an analyst/investor meet was announced on August 18, 2025. Additionally, a summary of the proceedings of the NCLT convened Meeting of Equity Shareholders held on August 12, 2025, was released. The outcome of remote e-voting and e-voting at the NCLT convened Meeting of Equity Shareholders held on August 12, 2025, was also announced. The company has announced several dividends. A final dividend of Rs 24 per share (2400%) with effective date of June 23, 2025, an interim dividend of Rs 19 per share (1900%) with effective date of November 6, 2024, a special dividend of Rs 10 per share (1000%) with effective date of November 6, 2024, an interim dividend of Rs 24 per share (2400%) with effective date of June 14, 2024 and an interim dividend of Rs 18 per share (1800%) with effective date of November 2, 2023. Hindustan Unilever has announced multiple bonus issues in the past. A bonus ratio of 1:2 was announced on September 30, 1991 and the ex-bonus date for the same was July 19, 1991. A bonus ratio of 1:1 was announced on June 22, 1987. A bonus ratio of 3:5 was announced on June 22, 1983. A bonus ratio of 1:3 was announced on June 22, 1979. The company had split its shares once in the past in the ratio 10:1. The announcement for the same was made on July 5, 2000, and the ex-split date was July 3, 2000. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment on the stock as of August 18, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 2,649.90, Hindustan Unilever is among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index, reflecting positive investor sentiment during today's session.

title: PG Electroplast steps up to diversify by making POS devices, days after AC sales slump hit guidance and roiled stock
content: PG Electroplast, a leading manufacturer of room air conditioners, which saw a massive 30 percent selloff earlier this month following a guidance cut and weak summer season sales, is in focus after its stock exiting the F&O ban and the company announcing a partnership with a global Point-of-Sale (POS) device maker on August 20. Shares of PG Electroplast are higher by over 5 percent in the trading session, though they are lower by 30 percent over last one month and down 45 percent on YTD basis. This agreement marks PGEL’s entry into payments and fintech hardware segment, which broadens the company's presence beyond consumer electronics into digital infrastructure solutions, seen as a 'high-growth' space by the company. As part of the agreement, PG Electro will manufacture PAX-branded POS devices at its existing facilities. "With this partnership, PGEL becomes one of the very few companies in India to manufacture POS devices, further diversifying our portfolio and reinforcing our commitment to scaling EMS in high-growth technology categories," Vikas Gupta, Managing Director – Operations, PG Electroplast said. India's digital payments ecosystem has been one of the fastest growing in the world, and this partnership aligns with the Make in India theme. "Partnering with PG Electroplast allows us to strengthen our presence in India by combining PAX’s technology leadership with PGEL’s proven manufacturing expertise," Sanjeev Sandhu, CEO of PAX India said. During the June quarter, PG Electro's net profit fell 21 percent on year to Rs 67 crore as against Rs 85 crore a year ago, as an early arrival of monsoon impacted seasonal sales, prompting it to lower its FY26 growth guidance. Following order cancellations this summer, the AC maker is now sitting on a substantial inventory of air conditioners and raw materials worth Rs 1,300 crore, which has cast a shadow on the full-year guidance. "...we were confident heading into FY26, and our guidance reflected that optimism. But what changed quite quickly and unexpectedly was the weather. The monsoon arrived earlier than usual, and the room AC season ended abruptly. Sellout in the trade channel was lower than forecasted and inventory levels stayed higher for longer. In hindsight, we were not fully prepared for that kind of shift in this quarter," Vishal Gupta, MD (Finance), PG Electroplast had said after the June quarter earnings. The company had invested to set up a new air conditioner compressor plant along with a Chinese partner for internal requirement as well as to supply to other OEMs, which has been delayed to fiscal 2027, adding to the recent sour sentiment. However, Geojit Financial recently issued a Buy call though with a lower price target of Rs 623 per share, stating that all negatives are priced in. Geojit expects PGEL's inventory to be cleared in H2FY26 as seasonal demand picks up, with management looking to diversify to other business verticals like refrigerator, EV and compressor manufacturing. "...we are planning a lot of diversifications and the results of those will be visible to you in the coming years," Pramod Gupta, CFO, PGEL said during the June quarter earnings call. As of FY24, PGEL generated over 60 percent of its revenue from air conditioners, washing machines and air coolers, and has now started to diversify into electronics, printed circuit board assemblies as well as plastic moulding. PGEL has already tied up to make EVs and lithium-ion batteries in partnership with Spiro Mobility (Africa). Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: PG Electroplast, a leading manufacturer of room air conditioners, which saw a massive 30 percent selloff earlier this month following a guidance cut and weak summer season sales, is in focus after its stock exiting the F&O ban and the company announcing a partnership with a global Point-of-Sale (POS) device maker on August 20.
summary_luhn: PG Electroplast, a leading manufacturer of room air conditioners, which saw a massive 30 percent selloff earlier this month following a guidance cut and weak summer season sales, is in focus after its stock exiting the F&O ban and the company announcing a partnership with a global Point-of-Sale (POS) device maker on August 20.

title: SJVN shares surge 3.80% amid high volume in today's session
content: Shares of SJVN experienced a notable surge of 3.80%, reaching Rs 98.49 in Wednesday's trading session. The stock saw a jump in volume and unusual trading activity. Trading Volume & Market Impact The trading volume in SJVN shares saw a significant surge during the session, which may reflect increased investor interest. The stock is traded on the NIFTY MIDCAP 150. Recent Financial Performance SJVN has demonstrated varied financial performance in its quarterly results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 917.45 Crore, compared to Rs 504.40 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the same period was Rs 236.89 Crore, against a loss of Rs 130.36 Crore in the previous quarter. title: Infosys shares gain 2.74% in Wednesday's session; stock among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Infosys shares rose 2.74% to Rs 1,479.50 in Wednesday's trading session. The stock is among the top gainers on Nifty 50. At 11:00 am, the stock was trading higher, reflecting a positive trend in the market. Infosys is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. The company's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth. Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 42,279 Crore, compared to Rs 39,315 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 6,924 Crore, up from Rs 6,374 Crore. The earnings per share (EPS) also increased from Rs 15.38 to Rs 16.70. The annual consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 162,990 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 153,670 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 26,750 Crore, compared to Rs 26,248 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The EPS also rose from Rs 63.39 to Rs 64.50.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Mar 2021100,472.0019,423.0045.61Mar 2022121,641.0022,146.0052.52Mar 2023146,767.0024,108.0057.63Mar 2024153,670.0026,248.0063.39Mar 2025162,990.0026,750.0064.50The company’s revenue increased by 5.41% in 2025 compared to 2024. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. Infosys announced a final dividend of Rs 22 per share (440%) with effect from May 30, 2025. Earlier dividends include an interim dividend of Rs 21 per share (420%) effective from October 29, 2024, and a final dividend of Rs 20 per share (400%) and a special dividend of Rs 8 per share (160%) both effective from May 31, 2024. The company has also announced bonus issues in the past, including a 1:1 bonus on July 13, 2018, and another 1:1 bonus on June 15, 2015. Shares of Infosys were trading higher, reflecting a positive trend in the market.

title: Sell KNR Constructions; target of Rs 163: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on KNR Constructions KNR Constructions (KNR) reported a revenue of INR 4.8bn in Q1FY26, down to a five-year trough. The lukewarm execution was primarily rooted in a smaller executable order book (OB). KNR has failed to grab any meaningful orders in the last two years, resulting in the weakened OB. Order inflow (OI) over the last two years has been tepid at ~INR 51bn vs. INR 100bn over FY21–22. As a result, its current executable OB stands weak at INR 48bn (excludes mining project of INR 35bn – to start from FY27). In light of this weakness, we cut our earnings. It has recently received appointed date for 2 HAM projects, which would instil some vim in execution, but KNR meeting its OI guidance of INR 100-120bn remains critical to see any upside. We maintain SELL at a revised TP of INR 163 (earlier INR 178). Outlook We cut our FY26E earnings by 28% due to the bleak execution outlook. We maintain SELL with a revised TP of INR 163 (INR 178 earlier). title: Hold Zydus Lifesciences: target of Rs 910: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Zydus Lifesciences Zydus Lifesciences (Zydus)’s Q1FY26 print beat our expectations, though its revenue grew a mere 5.9% while EBITDA/ PAT shrunk 3.3%/0.7% YoY. US biz sales were flat YoY. The company has started facing pricing headwinds in gRevlimid and the outcome of the litigation in Feb’26 shall be crucial for supplies of Mirabegron beyond Q4FY26. In the near term,its pipeline of 505 b(2) products like Sitagliptin and Docetaxel would aid strength to its US biz. India biz growth of 8% was in-line with IPM and the trend is likely to sustain in quarters ahead. Management maintains its single-digit growth guidance in US in FY26. Gross/EBITDA margin guidance of ~64%/26% for FY26 is retained. We cut FY26E/FY27E earnings by ~1% to factor in slightly lower margins. Retain HOLD with TP of INR 910, based on 22x FY27E earnings.Outlook We cut our FY26E/FY27E earnings by ~1% each to factor in lower margins. At CMP, the stock trades at valuations of 22x FY26E and 23.4x FY27E earnings, and EV/EBITDA of 13.5x FY26E and 13.6x FY27E. Maintain HOLD with an unchanged target price of INR 910, based on 22x FY27E EPS (unchanged). title: Hold Power Mech Projects: target of Rs 2986: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Power Mech Projects Power Mech reported a muted Q1FY26. Post-adjustment of the exceptional item (INR 2.9bn in revenue), revenue stood at INR 10bn (flat YoY), EBITDA was at INR 1.2bn (+6% YoY) and adjusted profit of INR 0.5bn (-18% YoY). Reported profit grew 31% YoY to INR 0.8bn. It also witnessed softness in order inflow (OI) due to delays in awarding of some pipeline projects; Q1 OI stood at INR 12.7bn (-27% YoY). Nonetheless, its order book (OB) remains healthy at INR 144bn (excluding MDO orders of INR 396bn) with a book-to-bill ratio of 2.8. The order outlook remains strong in the near-medium term given India’s revived interest in thermal power. With awards for greenfield thermal capacity going up in last few quarters and fresh opportunities likely in the nuclear power space, we expect a healthy pipeline over the next 2–3 years. We also expect the MDO business to aid in revenue accretion Q3FY26 onwards with contribution from the recently commenced KBP mine. We maintain HOLD. Outlook The company has been expanding its footprint beyond power services into segments like railways, water, and O&M, ensuring diversification and long-term growth visibility. It had an orderbook of INR 144bn (ex-MDO OB of INR 396bn), as of Q1FY26, translating to a book-to-bill ratio of 2.8x, providing strong revenue visibility. We maintain our HOLD rating on the stock with a TP of INR 2,986(unchanged). title: Hold Hindalco Industries: target of Rs 720: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Hindalco Industries Hindalco (HNDL)’ Q1FY26 operating performance was 6% ahead of consensus estimates despite Novelis’ underperformance. Consol. EBITDA, at INR 80.8bn, jumped 6% YoY. Lower Novelis EBITDA, at INR 35.6bbn (-15% YoY; UAD 28mn negative impact due to tariff), was largely compensated by better aluminium EBITDA at INR 42.4bn (+21% YoY; aided by lower CoP and better mix). Copper continues to do well at EBITDA of INR 6.7bn. Net debt also reduced by INR 10bn to INR 343bn. Given, higher-for-longer capex and near-term uncertainty in Novelis, we expect H1’s performance to be muted with improvement emerging H2 onwards. We maintain our HOLD rating on the stock with a target price of INR 720 (6.5x multiple to Novelis and 6x to domestic business for FY27E EV/EBITDA). Outlook We maintain our HOLD rating and target price of INR 720 based on 6.5x FY27E EV/EBITDA for Novelis and 6x for domestic business. title: Buy Suzlon Energy; target of Rs 76: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Suzlon Energy Suzlon has been delivering strong performance over the last few quarters. It had a very good FY25, wherein it: 1) bagged wind turbine orders worth ~3.6GW – its order book (OB) swelled to >5GW; 2) entered PSU orders, potentially opening the door for further penetration in the fast-growing PSU segment; 3) doubled down on execution, delivering >1.5GW wind turbines. It guides for 60% growth in FY26. Further, India has mandated wind equipment manufacturers to increase domestic sourcing; thereby, giving domestic OEMs a home advantage – Suzlon, with its ~40% market share, shall be a key beneficiary.In Q1FY26, the company reported its highest-ever Q1 execution at 444MW (vs. 274MW YoY). Also, it accumulated orders worth 1GW in Q1. Its OB stands at an impressive 5.7GW (~3.7x FY25 execution). Outlook We expect the order pipeline to be strong over the next 2–3 years. Retain BUY with a TP of INR 76. title: Buy Jyothy Labs; target of Rs 430: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Jyothy Labs JYL’s Q1FY26 performance was subdued with revenue/ volume growth of 1.4%/ 3.6% YoY impacted by heightened competitive intensity across segments. Volume growth was driven by Fabric care and Dishwash category, partially offset by the muted performance in HI (excluding HI, volume growth was 5%). Rural markets continue to outperform urban markets (impacted by downtrading). Going ahead, management remains cautiously optimistic with the recovery in H2 driven by NPD and recalibration packs, pricing and RTM strategy. GM contracted 328bps YoY to 48.0% on elevated input costs and promotions, leading to a 7% YoY EBITDA decline (margin -150bps to 16.5%). Management reiterated margin guidance of 17-18% for FY26. Maintain BUY. Outlook We cut our earnings estimates by ~2% for FY26-27E; modelling revenue / EBITDA / PAT CAGR of 7 / 8 / 8 (%) over FY25-27E. We maintain BUY with a DCF based revised target price of INR 430 (INR 450 previously). At our target price, the stock will trade at 36x P/E multiple FY27E. Key downside risks are higher competitive pressure and significant input cost inflation impacting margins. title: Buy Honasa Consumer; target of Rs 400: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Honasa Consumer Honasa started FY26 on steady footing – revenue/ UVG up 7.4%/ 10.5% YoY driven by 20%+ growth in focus categories across brands. Revenue growth was partially impacted by early onset of monsoon (200bps impact on revenue). Modern trade and e-commerce channel grew in double digits, while general trade channel sequential performance continues to improve on management initiatives. Younger brands, now contributing more than 50% of revenue, continue to register 20%+ growth. Overall profitability was stable during the quarter, which is expected to improve with operating scale in younger brands. Going ahead, scaling up of younger brands driven by NPDs and sustained improvement in Mamaearth’s performance on the back of RTM changes, should drive a healthy performance. BUY. Outlook Maintain BUY with a DCF-based target price of INR 400 as we roll forward to Sep’27E. At our TP, the stock will trade at 50x Sep’27E EPS. Key risks: 1) heightened competition, 2) execution miss, 3) low success in scale-up of new brands and 3) continued slowdown in Mamaearth. title: Buy Hindustan Aeronautics; target of Rs 5800: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Hindustan Aeronautics Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL’s) Q1FY26 performance was broadly in line with the management guidance. Key points:1) EBITDA surged 29% YoY mainly on higher revenue and lower provisioning. 2) Revision in company’s contribution to pension scheme from 7% to 10% of Basic + DA, resulted in an additional liability of INR 111mn. 3) Secured ToT of the Small Satellite Launch Vehicle (SSLV) from ISRO in a deal worth INR 5.1bn. 4) Received two engines for Tejas programme (FY26-YTD) while it plans to deliver at least five Tejas aircraft based on spare engines and new engines. Going ahead, management has guided for 8-10% revenue growth (at higher end), including RoH revenue of INR 200bn and stable EBITDA margin. We reinitiate coverage with BUY and TP of INR 5,800 (based on 40x FY27E EPS). Outlook We reinitiate coverage with BUY and target price of INR 5,800, based on 40x FY27E EPS (marginal premium to average multiple to factor in strong order pipeline). title: Buy Astral; target of Rs 1540: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Astral Astral reported a lower-than-expected Q1FY26 with pipe volume growth of 0.5% YoY (6-year CAGR of 10%). Consol. revenue fell 1.6% YoY with pipes/adhesives segments being -6.7%/+8.6% YoY. Pipes’ reported EBITDA/kg declined 14.3% YoY to INR 27.9/kg (adjusted for inventory losses of INR 250mn, it was flat YoY). Adhesives’ OPM dipped 203bps YoY to 10.3%, as India business’ margins shrank ~200 bps YoY while the UK business continued to languish. Astral announced the acquisition of Nexelon Chem, which would manufacture CPVC resin from Q2FY27; thus, enabling the company to be backward-integrated and more cost competitive. We believe, this backward integration could structurally improve the growth/margin profile of the piping business. We tweak our estimates and upgrade the stock to BUY (from Hold) with a rolled over Jun’26 TP of INR 1,540. Outlook We upgrade the stock to BUY, from Hold – post the recent stock price correction and given the stronger possibility in earnings resilience – with a rolled over Jun’26 TP of INR 1,540 (earlier INR 1,504); set at unchanged 55x PER one-year forward (~15% discount to 10-year average PER) For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. title: Buy Ashoka Buildcon; target of Rs 220: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Ashoka Buildcon Ashoka Buildcon (Ashoka) reported a weak Q1FY26 with execution impacted amid early monsoons. As a result, revenue came in at INR 13bn (-30% YoY), its lowest in the last 10 quarters. That said, EBITDA margins expanded to 9.3% (+290bps YoY), albeit with a lower PAT of INR 0.3bn (-25% YoY). Management sees Q2 similar Q1, while execution to pick up in H2FY26.Its guidance of 10% revenue growth for FY26 is likely to encounter some stress, in our view. Hence, we revise our earnings. In more favourable light, its OB is steady at INR 159bn (+15% YoY) with a promising order pipeline of INR 3.4trn from NHAI (INR 0.8trn near-term visibility). Deals should see completion by Sep’26E, enabling net cash inflow of ~INR 15bn; thus,allowing debt levels to ebb. The stock is trading at 8x EV/EBITDA (2-year forward) vs. its historical average ~10x. We retain BUY; TP revised to INR 220 on inexpensive valuations Outlook We maintain BUY with a revised TP of INR 220 (vs. INR 259), primarily on the back of cheaper valuations and potential near-term cash flows. title: Buy Alkem Laboratories; target of Rs 6065: ICICI Securities
content: ICICI Securities's research report on Alkem Laboratories Alkem Laboratories (Alkem)’s Q1FY26 performance exceeded our expectations on all fronts. The outperformance was led by a strong showing in India (up 12%) and improved momentum across US (+8.8%) and other international markets (+9%). Gross margin expanded 75bps YoY to 65.3% led by mix improvement and lower input cost. EBITDA margins jumped 185bps YoY helped by lower R&D (down 60bps YoY). Ahead,robust growth in volumes in its branded generics segment in India, along with new launches (gEntresto in Q2) in US, is likely to drive a 10.6% revenue CAGR over FY25–27E; also, margins may remain range bound between 19–20% in the near term due to losses in its new venture (INR 2.4–3bn p.a.). We raise our FY26/27E EPS by ~4%. Upgrade to BUY on attractive valuations; TP revised to INR 6,065 (vs. INR 5,900) on 22x FY27E EV/EBITDA. Outlook The stock trades at valuations of 25.6x FY26E and 30.9x FY27E earnings and EV/EBITDA multiple of 20.6x FY26E and 18.1x FY27E. Upgrade to BUY (earlier Add) with a higher target price of INR 6,065 (earlier INR 5,900), based on 22x FY27E EV/EBITDA (unchanged). title: Ola Electric shares jump 11% as 0.3% equity change hands on block deal
content: Shares of Ola Electric Mobility jumped as much as 11 percent to Rs 49 per share on August 20 as around 0.3 percent equity of the company changed hands through ten block deals. The stock has now gained in four out of the last five trading sessions. In the past one week, shares of Ola Electric have surged by 20 percent, compared to a one percent rise in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog Earlier this week, the stock gained further attention after founder and chairman Bhavish Aggarwal laid out an ambitious growth strategy at the company’s annual Sankalp event. The company is aiming for a 25 to 30 percent share of India’s two-wheeler electric vehicle market, backed by vertical integration and new product launches. “Our target market share for two-wheeler EVs is about 25 to 30 percent with very high margins, so we believe we are on the trajectory again,” Aggarwal said. He added that Ola’s “mojo is still there” despite the challenges faced during its transition phase. Over the past 6 months, Ola Electric phased out its Gen 2 scooters, increased supplies of its Gen 3 models, and rolled out its first electric bike. “It’s been two quarters of transition. Along with product transition, we’ve had a distribution scale-up. You’ll now see, leading into the festive season, the market share volumes starting to inch upwards,” Aggarwal noted. He also stressed that profitability in electric vehicles requires more than just scale. “No one is making money. To make money with EVs, you need vertical integration, you need the technology development, you need the DNA of technology,” Aggarwal said. On the earnings side, Ola Electric reported a weak first quarter compared with the same period last year, though results were better when compared sequentially. Losses narrowed and revenue improved quarter-on-quarter. The company’s gross margin improved by 1,100 basis points sequentially and by 740 basis points compared to last year. Gross margins stood at 26 percent at the end of the June quarter, while the management expects the full-year gross margin to be in the range of 35 to 40 percent. title: Indian Hotels Company shares rise 2.14% in Wednesday's trading session
content: Indian Hotels Company shares climbed 2.14% to Rs 791.75 in Wednesday's session. At 09:51 am, the stock showed positive movement, reflecting an upward trend from the previous close. The stock is part of the NIFTY NEXT 50 index. Financial Highlights Indian Hotels Company's financial performance reveals the following trends: Consolidated Quarterly Results: The company's consolidated quarterly revenue has shown growth. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,041.08 Crore, up from Rs 1,550.23 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period increased to Rs 319.42 Crore from Rs 234.21 Crore. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) also rose to Rs 2.08 in June 2025 compared to Rs 1.75 in June 2024. Consolidated Yearly Results: The consolidated yearly revenue has consistently increased over the years. For the year-ending March 2025, the revenue was Rs 8,334.54 Crore, compared to Rs 6,768.75 Crore in March 2024. The net profit also saw a significant rise, reaching Rs 1,961.25 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 1,201.59 Crore in March 2024. The EPS increased to Rs 13.40 in March 2025 from Rs 8.86 in March 2024. Key financial metrics are summarized in the tables below:Revenue (Quarterly, Consolidated)Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025Value (Rs Crore)1,550.231,826.122,533.052,425.142,041.08Net Profit (Quarterly, Consolidated)Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025Value (Rs Crore)234.21573.21613.82540.01319.42EPS (Quarterly, Consolidated)Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025Value (Rs)1.753.894.093.672.08Revenue (Yearly, Consolidated)20212022202320242025Value (Rs Crore)1,575.163,056.225,809.916,768.758,334.54Net Profit (Yearly, Consolidated)20212022202320242025Value (Rs Crore)-694.21-222.40971.431,201.591,961.25EPS (Yearly, Consolidated)20212022202320242025Value (Rs)-6.05-1.977.068.8613.40The total sales for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 8,334 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 6,768 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,961 Crore, significantly higher than the Rs 1,201 Crore reported in the previous year. Corporate Actions Indian Hotels Company has announced several corporate actions, including dividend payouts and investor meetings. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 2.25 per share on May 5, 2025, with an effective date of June 30, 2025. Additionally, the transcript of the IHCL Investors Call held on August 12, 2025, was disclosed on August 18, 2025. Indian Hotels Company announced a stock split on July 27, 2006, where the old face value of Rs 10 was split into a new face value of Rs 1, effective from October 27, 2006. Moneycontrol analysis on August 13, 2025, indicated a neutral sentiment for Indian Hotels Company.

title: KPR Mill shares rise 2.09% in Wednesday's session; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of KPR Mill gained 2.09% in Wednesday's trading session, with the stock currently trading at Rs 1,018.70. The stock was among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 9:45 am. title: Hindustan Unilever shares rise marginally in early trade
content: In Wednesday's session, shares of Hindustan Unilever were trading at Rs 2,612.60, a 0.30% increase from the previous close, as of 9:30 am. The stock is part of the Nifty 50 index. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions Hindustan Unilever announced a final dividend of Rs.24.00 per share (2400%) on April 24, 2025, with an effective date of June 23, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs.19.00 per share (1900%) and a special dividend of Rs.10.00 per share (1000%) were announced on October 10 and October 11, 2024, respectively, both with an effective date of November 6, 2024. The company has also issued bonus shares in the past, with the most recent bonus issue on September 30, 1991, in the ratio of 1:2, with exbonus date on July 19, 1991. Additionally, Hindustan Unilever underwent a stock split on July 5, 2000, where the old face value of Rs 10 was split into a new face value of Rs 1. According to Moneycontrol analysis, the sentiment for Hindustan Unilever is very bullish as of August 18, 2025. With the stock currently trading at Rs 2,612.60, Hindustan Unilever shows a marginal increase from its previous day's closing.

title: Tata Consultancy Services shares rise in early trade
content: Tata Consultancy Services' stock is trading at Rs 3,028.30, reflecting a moderate gain of 0.40% in Wednesday's early session. The Nifty 50-listed stock showed slight upward movement compared to its previous close, as of 9:30 am. title: Larsen & Toubro share price falls in early trade
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading lower at Rs 3,589.20 on Wednesday's session, a decline of 0.66% from the previous close. The stock is a part of the Nifty 50 index. Net profit also followed a similar trend, with the highest profit recorded in March 2025 at Rs 6,133.44 Crore. Earnings per share (EPS) reached its highest in March 2025 at 39.98. title: Aurobindo Pharma shares slide 4% on reports of Zentiva buyout talks
content: Aurobindo Pharma shares fell over 4 percent to Rs 1,039 apiece on August 20 after reports suggested that the company has emerged as the front-runner to acquire Prague-based generic drugmaker Zentiva for $5-5.5 billion (Rs 43,500-47,900 crore) from Advent International. If this deal goes through, it will be the largest-ever acquisition by an Indian pharmaceutical company, both domestically and internationally. It would surpass the $3.2 billion acquisition of Daiichi Sankyo’s stake in Ranbaxy in 2014, as well as Biocon Biologics’ $3.3 billion cash-and-stock deal to buy the global biosimilars business of US-based Viatris, the report said. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog According to the report, the deal is expected to strengthen Aurobindo’s footprint in Europe, particularly in Eastern European markets such as the Czech Republic, Romania, and Slovakia. These regions are seen as promising growth areas for biosimilars, especially as patents of major prescription drugs expire. So far in 2025, Aurobindo Pharma’s stock has declined by 21 percent, compared with a 2 percent modest rise in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. On the financial front, the company posted a consolidated net profit of Rs 824 crore in the June 2025 quarter (Q1 FY26), compared with Rs 918 crore in the same quarter of the previous year (Q1 FY25), reflecting a 10.2 percent year-on-year decline. Revenue from operations stood at Rs 7,868 crore in Q1 FY26, up four percent from Rs 7,567 crore in Q1 FY25. Operating EBITDA came in at Rs 1,603 crore in Q1 FY26 compared to Rs 1,619.6 crore in Q1 FY25. The EBITDA margin slipped to 20.4 percent year-on-year from 21.4 percent in the same quarter last year. Aurobindo Pharma’s US formulations revenue fell 1.9 percent year-on-year to Rs 3,488 crore ($408 million). The decline was attributed to destocking and seasonal headwinds. However, the company’s European formulations business remained strong, recording an 18 percent year-on-year growth to Rs 2,338 crore. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Nifty top gainers: Bharti Airtel, Infosys stocks lead gains on Nifty 50 index today
content: At 9:25 am on Wednesday, August 20, 2025, positive index contributors for Nifty 50 included Bharti Airtel, Infosys and NTPC, among others. Bharti Airtel was trading at Rs 1,938.60, up 1.5%. Infosys was at Rs 1,459.90, a gain of 1.33%. NTPC was trading at Rs 339.40, up 1.34%. title: Info Edge CFO Chintan Thakkar resigns after 12-year tenure; shares down 1%
content: The shares of Info Edge dropped around 1 percent in the early trading hours of August 20 after the company announced that its CFO Chintan Thakkar has resigned. The shares of the parent company of job search portal Naukri were trading at Rs 1,365 apiece. In an exchange filing, Info Edge announced that Chintan Thakkar resigned on August 19 to pursue another career opportunity in a different career trajectory. He will be relived from his responsibilities as the Chief Financial Officer of the company on or before November 19. After Thakkar's resignation, the board of directors of the company appointed Ambarish Raghuvanshi as the Interim CFO and key managerial personnel, with effect from November 20, until the appointment of a new CFO. Raghuvanshi earlier served as the CFO of the company between 2001 and 2014. "The Company is in the process of identifying and appointing a suitable successor for the position of Chief Financial Officer," it added. Info Edge thanked Chintan Thakkar for his tenure as the CFO of the company. "The Board of Directors places on record its sincere appreciation for Mr. Thakkar’s invaluable contributions. In his tenure as Director and Chief Financial Officer, he played a pivotal role in driving the Company’s strategic initiatives, including capital market transactions, fund-raising and investor relations. He upheld the highest standards of corporate governance and transparency in financial reporting, thereby reinforcing stakeholder trust and regulatory compliance. His leadership has left a lasting impact on the Company’s growth trajectory and financial stewardship," it said. In his resignation letter, Thakkar highlighted how Info Edge transitioned from a smallcap to a largecap company during his tenure, with in market capitalization growing 18x since he joined as the CFO. He further noted that the company's AIFs and investment vehicles enabled it to support over 100 promising tech and deep-tech startups. According to Thakkar, he is confident that these investments will "continue to create value for years to come, much like early investment in Zomato and Policybazaar have done for lnfoedge over the past one and a half decades". "In my pursuit of empowering experiences and enriching growth, I will transition into a career in Investments as Group CEO of IAN Group and Senior Managing Partner at IAN Alpha Fund. IAN is one of the pioneers, and today, it is the country's largest platform for early-stage investing, with both Angel and VC Funds," Thakkar added. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates
summary_lexrank: After Thakkar's resignation, the board of directors of the company appointed Ambarish Raghuvanshi as the Interim CFO and key managerial personnel, with effect from November 20, until the appointment of a new CFO.
summary_luhn: The shares of Info Edge dropped around 1 percent in the early trading hours of August 20 after the company announced that its CFO Chintan Thakkar has resigned.
summary_lsa: His leadership has left a lasting impact on the Company’s growth trajectory and financial stewardship," it said.
summary_textrank: After Thakkar's resignation, the board of directors of the company appointed Ambarish Raghuvanshi as the Interim CFO and key managerial personnel, with effect from November 20, until the appointment of a new CFO.

title: Bharti Airtel shares gain 1.94% in early trade

Financial Performance: Consolidated Quarterly Performance: The revenue for Bharti Airtel has shown consistent growth over the past five quarters. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 49,462.60 Crore, up from Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 7,339.00 Crore, compared to Rs 3,805.80 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS stood at Rs 10.26 in June 2025, compared to Rs 7.21 in June 2024. Consolidated Annual Performance: Bharti Airtel has demonstrated substantial year-on-year revenue growth. The revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 172,985.20 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 149,982.40 Crore in March 2024. The EPS also saw a substantial rise, reaching Rs 58.00 in March 2025, compared to Rs 13.09 in March 2024. title: Maruti Suzuki India shares hit all-time high of Rs 14,362 on NSE, up 0.8%
content: Shares of Maruti Suzuki India reached an all-time high of Rs 14,362.00 on the NSE in Wednesday's early session, rising 0.8% from the previous close. Financial Snapshot The following tables present key financial data for Maruti Suzuki India. title: Sensex, Nifty snap 4-day gaining streak as bank, pharma stocks drag
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex kickstart the session on a slightly muted note on August 20 as profit-booking at higher levels led to a snap in the market’s four-day winning streak. Bank and pharma stocks were the top drags while the broader market also edged lower. At about 9:40 am, the Sensex was down 52.07 points or 0.06 percent at 81,592.32, and the Nifty was down 25.80 points or 0.10 percent at 24,954.85. About 1536 shares advanced, 1462 shares declined, and 148 shares were unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates "A sustained rally looks unlikely with the August 27 deadline for the 25 percent secondary tariff on India nearing, and signals from the Trump administration turning increasingly negative. President Trump’s tariff stance, seen as arbitrary and unpredictable, could persist, weighing on India in the near term and forcing the market to factor in its impact," V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Investments Ltd, said. Experts say FII selling is also a worry for markets. To be sure, Foreign investors (FIIs/FPIs) turned net sellers again on Tuesday, after a day of buying, offloading Indian equities worth Rs 634 crore. Domestic institutional investors (DIIs), meanwhile, sustained their support with net purchases of Rs 2,261 crore, according to provisional exchange data. At the opening bell, sectoral trends were mixed. Nifty Auto, IT and Consumer Durables were largely flat, while FMCG, Pharma, Metal, PSU Bank, Private Bank and Oil & Gas saw mild declines. Banking stocks were under pressure, dragging Nifty Bank down 0.4 percent. On the positive side, Energy, Infra and Realty indices inched higher, even as Media slipped nearly 1 percent. Volatility also edged up, with India VIX rising 0.9 percent. Among individual stocks, state-run defence equipment manufacturer Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd. (HAL) rose xx percent after CNBC TV-18 reported that the company is likely to receive a big purchase order. The Cabinet Committee on Security (CCS) has cleared the purchase of 97 Light Combat Aircraft (LCA) Mark1A fighter jets worth Rs 62,000 crore from HAL. An official confirmation would mean one of the largest purchase orders for the state-run enterprise, where the fighter jets would be indigenously developed. Shares of online gaming companies, including Delta Corp, Nazara Technologies and OnMobile Global, tumbled up to x percent after the Union Cabinet approved a Bill to regulate the sector. The proposed law prohibits online money gaming and related advertisements, prescribing fines and imprisonment for violators. Phoenix Mills shares jumped x percent after the company said the Competition Commission of India cleared its plan to buy out Canada Pension Plan Investment Board’s 49 percent stake in Island Star Mall Development for Rs 5,449.16 crore, giving PML full ownership and sole control of the subsidiary. Technical View Nifty continues to demonstrate strength while holding above its gap support near 24,800. A sustained breakout above 25,050 could unleash strong bullish momentum, as significant call writers risk being trapped, leading to potential short covering. On the downside, any dip towards the 24,750 zone is likely to be absorbed as an accumulation opportunity. Robust positioning by Put writers at near-the-money strikes further reinforces this constructive view. Only a decisive breach below 24,700 would warrant caution; until then, the bulls are expected to maintain control. For now, a “buy on dips” strategy remains the most prudent approach, with traders closely watching for a decisive breakout to resolve the current consolidation phase. Bharti Airtel, NTPC, Infosys, Eternal, and Hindustan Unilever were the top gainers on the Nifty. Shriram Finance, Bajaj Finance, Jio Financial Services, Hindalco, and Tata Motors were the major laggards. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Bank and pharma stocks were the top drags while the broader market also edged lower.
summary_luhn: At about 9:40 am, the Sensex was down 52.07 points or 0.06 percent at 81,592.32, and the Nifty was down 25.80 points or 0.10 percent at 24,954.85.
summary_lsa: Among individual stocks, state-run defence equipment manufacturer Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd. (HAL) rose xx percent after CNBC TV-18 reported that the company is likely to receive a big purchase order.

title: Eternal-Zomato stock hits all-time high of Rs 327.50 on BSE, up 1.9%

Financial Snapshot Consolidated Financials (Yearly) Eternal's annual revenue has shown consistent growth over the past five years. The revenue for the year 2025 stood at Rs 20,243.00 Crore, a significant increase compared to Rs 12,114.00 Crore in 2024. Similarly, the net profit has improved, with Rs 527.00 Crore reported in 2025 compared to Rs 351.00 Crore in 2024. title: Paytm shares hit 52-week high as Motilal Oswal Mutual Fund raises holding
content: Shares of One 97 Communications, the parent company of Paytm, rose by one percent to hit a fresh 52-week high of Rs 1,238 apiece on August 20 after Motilal Oswal Mutual Fund crossed the 5 percent shareholding mark. The fund house bought an additional 26.31 lakh shares, which is equal to 0.41 percent of the company’s total equity, through open market deals on August 11, 2024. After this purchase, its total shareholding in One 97 Communications increased to 3.29 crore shares, representing 5.15 percent of the company’s total equity capital. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog Before this transaction, Motilal Oswal Mutual Fund held 3.02 crore shares, which was a 4.75 percent stake. With the fresh acquisition, the mutual fund has now crossed the key 5 percent disclosure threshold under SEBI’s Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeovers (SAST) Regulations, 2011. The purchase was spread across several Motilal Oswal Mutual Fund schemes, including Motilal Oswal Nifty Midcap 100 ETF, Motilal Oswal Focused Fund, Motilal Oswal Midcap Fund, Motilal Oswal Flexi Cap Fund, Motilal Oswal ELSS Tax Saver Fund, Motilal Oswal Balanced Advantage Fund, Motilal Oswal Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund, Motilal Oswal Nifty 500 Index Fund, and others. The move comes at a time when investor interest in fintech and digital companies is seeing a revival, even as Paytm continues to face a demanding regulatory and competitive environment. On the earnings front, the company reported a strong turnaround for the quarter ended June 2025 (Q1FY26). It posted a consolidated net profit of Rs 122.5 crore, a major reversal from the net loss of Rs 839 crore in the same quarter last year. Operating revenue rose 28 percent year-on-year to Rs 1,917 crore, compared to Rs 1,502 crore in Q1FY25. Sequential growth was flat at 0.3 percent as revenue in Q4FY25 stood at Rs 1,911 crore, when the company had reported a net loss of Rs 540 crore. The company said that revenue growth was driven by an increase in subscription-based merchants, higher Gross Merchandise Value (GMV), and better income from financial services distribution. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

summary_luhn: The purchase was spread across several Motilal Oswal Mutual Fund schemes, including Motilal Oswal Nifty Midcap 100 ETF, Motilal Oswal Focused Fund, Motilal Oswal Midcap Fund, Motilal Oswal Flexi Cap Fund, Motilal Oswal ELSS Tax Saver Fund, Motilal Oswal Balanced Advantage Fund, Motilal Oswal Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund, Motilal Oswal Nifty 500 Index Fund, and others.

title: Hindustan Aeronautics shares rise 2.83% in early trade
content: Shares of Hindustan Aeronautics were trading higher at Rs 4,578.80, up by 2.83% in Wednesday's early session. The stock is showing positive movement in the Nifty Next 50 index. On the financial front, Hindustan Aeronautics has demonstrated consistent performance. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 4,819.01 Crore, compared to Rs 4,347.50 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 1,373.49 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 1,431.11 Crore reported in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS stood at Rs 20.69 in June 2025, compared to Rs 21.49 in June 2024. The company's annual consolidated revenue has also seen growth, with Rs 30,980.95 Crore in 2025 compared to Rs 30,381.08 Crore in 2024. The net profit increased from Rs 7,594.45 Crore in 2024 to Rs 8,323.40 Crore in 2025. The EPS also rose, from Rs 113.95 in 2024 to Rs 125.07 in 2025. Here's a more detailed look at the company's financial performance:ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 4,347.50 CroreRs 5,976.29 CroreRs 6,957.31 CroreRs 13,699.85 CroreRs 4,819.01 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,431.11 CroreRs 1,498.46 CroreRs 1,434.36 CroreRs 3,959.47 CroreRs 1,373.49 CroreEPS21.4922.5921.5359.4620.69Particulars20212022202320242025RevenueRs 22,754.54 CroreRs 24,620.02 CroreRs 26,927.46 CroreRs 30,381.08 CroreRs 30,980.95 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,234.25 CroreRs 5,080.11 CroreRs 5,824.86 CroreRs 7,594.45 CroreRs 8,323.40 CroreEPS96.87151.92174.28113.95125.07BVPS461.02577.68705.04435.75523.07ROE21.0126.3024.7226.1523.91Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00The company announced financial results for the quarter ending June 30th, 2025, on August 12, 2025. The board meeting for consideration and approval of the audited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, was also scheduled on August 12, 2025. Hindustan Aeronautics announced a final dividend of Rs 15 per share (300%) with an effective date of August 21, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 25 per share (500%) was announced on February 10, 2025, with an effective date of February 18, 2025. The company had a stock split on September 28, 2023, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 5. Moneycontrol analysis, as of August 13, 2025, suggests a bearish sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 4,578.80, Hindustan Aeronautics demonstrates a positive move in today's session in the Nifty Next 50 index.

title: One 97 Communications Paytm shares hit 52-week high; stock gains 0.47%
content: Shares of One 97 Communications Paytm hit a 52-week high of Rs 1,232.95 on the BSE in Wednesday's session. At 9:16 am, the stock was trading at Rs 1,232, a gain of 0.47% from its previous close. Financial Snapshot: Consolidated Quarterly Performance: The company's consolidated quarterly revenue has shown consistent growth. The revenue for June 2024 was Rs 1,501.60 Crore, which increased to Rs 1,659.50 Crore in September 2024, Rs 1,827.80 Crore in December 2024, and further to Rs 1,911.50 Crore in March 2025. The latest quarter, June 2025, saw revenue reaching Rs 1,917.50 Crore. The net profit saw fluctuations, with a loss of Rs 838.80 Crore in June 2024, a profit of Rs 925.70 Crore in September 2024, losses of Rs 208.30 Crore and Rs 544.30 Crore in December 2024 and March 2025 respectively, and a profit of Rs 122.10 Crore in June 2025. The earnings per share (EPS) followed a similar trend, with corresponding values of -13.00, 14.59, -3.27, -8.47, and 1.92 for the respective quarters.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,501.60 CroreRs 1,659.50 CroreRs 1,827.80 CroreRs 1,911.50 CroreRs 1,917.50 CroreNet Profit-Rs 838.80 CroreRs 925.70 Crore-Rs 208.30 Crore-Rs 544.30 CroreRs 122.10 CroreEPS-13.0014.59-3.27-8.471.92Consolidated Yearly Performance: The company's consolidated yearly revenue has increased from Rs 2,802.40 Crore in 2021 to Rs 9,977.80 Crore in 2024 before decreasing to Rs 6,900.40 Crore in 2025. The net profit has consistently been negative, with a loss of Rs 1,627.00 Crore in 2021, increasing to Rs 2,350.50 Crore in 2022, then decreasing to Rs 1,764.00 Crore in 2023, and further to Rs 1,384.70 Crore in 2024. The loss decreased to Rs 665.70 Crore in 2025. The EPS also reflects this trend, with values of -281.16 in 2021 improving to -10.35 in 2025. The book value per share (BVPS) was Rs 1,077.02 in 2021, which dropped significantly to Rs 217.71 in 2022, and then stabalized to Rs 235.53 in 2025. The return on equity (ROE) has been negative, improving from -25.95% in 2021 to -4.38% in 2025. title: Ola Electric Mobility shares rise 3.88% in early trade
content: Shares of Ola Electric Mobility were trading higher in Wednesday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 46.57, a 3.88% increase from the previous close, as of 9:17 am. The company's consolidated financial performance reveals the following trends: Quarterly Results: For the quarter ending June 2025, Ola Electric Mobility reported revenue of Rs 828 Crore and a net loss of Rs 428 Crore. In comparison, the revenue for the quarter ending June 2024 was Rs 1,644 Crore, with a net loss of Rs 347 Crore. The revenue for the quarter ending March 2025 stood at Rs 611 Crore, while the net loss was Rs 870 Crore. The EPS for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs -0.97, compared to Rs -0.95 for the quarter ending June 2024. Annual Results: For the year ending March 2025, the company's revenue was Rs 4,514 Crore, and the net loss amounted to Rs 2,276 Crore. The EPS for the year ending March 2025 was Rs -5.48. In comparison, for the year ending March 2024, revenue was Rs 5,009.83 Crore, and the net loss was Rs 1,584.40 Crore. The EPS for the year ending March 2024 was Rs -4.35.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)2022373.42-784.15-2.2320232,630.93-1,472.08-3.9120245,009.83-1,584.40-4.3520254,514.00-2,276.00-5.48The company’s revenue decreased by 9.89 percent in 2025 compared to 2024. title: HAL shares gain 3% as cabinet clears Rs 62,000 crore order for 97 Tejas Mk1A fighter jets
content: Shares of Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd (HAL) gained as much as 3.5 percent to Rs 4,605 in morning deals on Wednesday, August 20, after reports suggested that the state-run defence manufacturer is set to bag one of its largest ever orders. According to government sources cited by CNBC TV-18, the Cabinet Committee on Security has cleared the acquisition of 97 Light Combat Aircraft (LCA) Mark1A fighter jets for about Rs 62,000 crore. A formal announcement would mark a major milestone for HAL, which has been working on the indigenous Tejas programme to replace India’s ageing MiG-21 fleet. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates The LCA Mk1A, an upgraded variant of the Tejas, has been designed for enhanced combat capabilities. This will be the second big order for the aircraft after HAL secured a contract in February 2021. Deliveries are expected to kick off this year, with six jets scheduled for FY26, following the resolution of earlier engine supply challenges. UBS has maintained a ‘neutral’ stance on the stock with a target price of Rs 4,900, noting that execution of the new order will add to HAL’s already strong pipeline. Meanwhile, HAL posted a mixed performance in its June quarter results. Net profit declined 3.7 percent year-on-year to Rs 1,383.8 crore, even as revenue from operations climbed 10.8 percent to Rs 4,819 crore. A healthier product mix and execution of its Rs 1.89 lakh crore order book lifted operating performance — EBITDA rose nearly 30 percent to Rs 1,284 crore, with margins expanding to 26.7 percent from 22.8 percent a year earlier, defying expectations of a contraction. With a robust order pipeline, improving margins and a fresh round of aircraft orders in the offing, HAL remains firmly positioned at the centre of India’s defence manufacturing push. After Q1, Motilal Oswal said that the aircraft deliveries will likely pick up pace as engine supplies from GE ramp up, which should further support revenue visibility. At about 9:20 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 4,560, higher by 2.5 percent from the last close on the NSE. Hindustan Aeronautics Limited shares are down 8 percent in the last three months. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: RVNL final dividend ex-date tomorrow; Rs 1.72 per share dividend due
content: Rail Vikas Nigam Ltd (RVNL) announced a final dividend of ₹1.72 per share, with the ex-date due tomorrow, August 21, 2025. Investors who hold shares of Rail Vikas Nigam until the end of today will be eligible to receive the dividend. Today is the last day to buy or sell the stock before it trades ex-dividend tomorrow onwards. RVNL stock's last traded price was Rs 327.75, reflecting a 1.22% increase compared to its previous closing price. This dividend announcement is a noteworthy event for shareholders, offering a tangible return on their investment. Rail Vikas Nigam's financial performance over the past year provides context for this dividend announcement. The company's revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at ₹19,923.01 crore, while the net profit was ₹1,186.11 crore. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for the same period was ₹6.15. These figures reflect the company's ability to generate profits and reward its shareholders. The market capitalization of Rail Vikas is ₹68,336.53 Crore A review of Rail Vikas Nigam's financial ratios further illustrates the company's performance. The Book Value Per Share (BVPS) for the year ending March 2025 was ₹45.90, and the Return on Equity (ROE) was 13.38%. The Debt to Equity ratio stood at 0.56, indicating a relatively healthy balance sheet. These ratios are important indicators of the company's financial health and its ability to generate returns for its shareholders.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per share₹1.72Ex-DateAugust 20, 2025From a financial year point of view, the company's performance can be examined based on key metrics. The revenue saw a decline from ₹21,889 crore in March 2024 to ₹19,923 crore in March 2025. Similarly, the net profit decreased from ₹1,574 crore to ₹1,186 crore. The EPS also experienced a reduction from ₹7.55 to ₹6.15. BVPS increased from ₹41.95 to ₹45.90, while ROE decreased from 18.00% to 13.38%. The Debt to Equity ratio reduced from 0.68 to 0.56. Analyzing the Income Statement, the company's sales dropped from ₹21,889 crore in March 2024 to ₹19,923 crore in March 2025. Other Income also decreased from ₹1,185 crore to ₹999 crore. Total Income decreased from ₹23,074 crore to ₹20,922 crore. Total Expenditure decreased from ₹20,452 crore to ₹18,828 crore, resulting in a decrease in EBIT from ₹2,622 crore to ₹2,094 crore. Interest payments reduced from ₹568 crore to ₹539 crore, and Tax decreased from ₹479 crore to ₹368 crore. Looking at the Balance Sheet, the Share Capital remained constant at ₹2,085 crore. Reserves & Surplus increased from ₹6,660 crore to ₹7,485 crore. Current Liabilities increased from ₹4,579 crore to ₹5,652 crore, and Other Liabilities decreased from ₹6,286 crore to ₹5,258 crore. Total Liabilities decreased from ₹19,611 crore to ₹20,481 crore. On the asset side, Fixed Assets increased from ₹460 crore to ₹1,027 crore, Current Assets increased from ₹9,745 crore to ₹11,667 crore, and Other Assets decreased from ₹9,405 crore to ₹7,787 crore. The Contingent Liabilities decreased significantly from ₹7,534 crore to ₹0. The announcement of a final dividend reflects Rail Vikas Nigam's commitment to delivering value to its shareholders despite recent fluctuations in key financial metrics.
summary_lexrank: The announcement of a final dividend reflects Rail Vikas Nigam's commitment to delivering value to its shareholders despite recent fluctuations in key financial metrics.
summary_luhn: On the asset side, Fixed Assets increased from ₹460 crore to ₹1,027 crore, Current Assets increased from ₹9,745 crore to ₹11,667 crore, and Other Assets decreased from ₹9,405 crore to ₹7,787 crore.
summary_lsa: Rail Vikas Nigam Ltd (RVNL) announced a final dividend of ₹1.72 per share, with the ex-date due tomorrow, August 21, 2025.
summary_textrank: On the asset side, Fixed Assets increased from ₹460 crore to ₹1,027 crore, Current Assets increased from ₹9,745 crore to ₹11,667 crore, and Other Assets decreased from ₹9,405 crore to ₹7,787 crore.

title: Thomas Cook Final Dividend Ex-Date Tomorrow; Rs 0.45 Per Share Dividend Due
content: Thomas Cook India has announced a final dividend of Rs 0.45 per share. The ex-date is due tomorrow, on 21 Aug 2025. This means that shareholders who hold the shares today will be eligible for the dividend payout; today is the last day to buy or sell the stock before it starts trading ex-dividend tomorrow. Thomas Cook stock's last traded price was Rs 166.57, reflecting a 2.14% increase compared to its previous close. Dividend Details The final dividend of Rs 0.45 per share represents a portion of the company’s earnings being distributed to its shareholders. The dividend payout is subject to shareholder approval at the upcoming Annual General Meeting. Financial Performance Overview Thomas Cook India has demonstrated substantial revenue growth over the past five years. Consolidated revenue increased from Rs 795 crore in 2021 to Rs 8,139.57 crore in 2025. Net profit has also seen a turnaround, shifting from a loss of Rs 295.18 crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 254.61 crore in 2025. This financial recovery is reflected in the company’s Earnings Per Share (EPS), which improved from -Rs 6.83 in 2021 to Rs 5.46 in 2025. In the quarter ending June 2025, revenue stood at Rs 2,407.96 crore, up from Rs 2,105.94 crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same quarter was Rs 73.40 crore, slightly higher than the Rs 73.01 crore reported in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS for June 2025 was Rs 1.55. Quarterly Financial Highlights (Consolidated)Quarterly Financial Performance (in ₹ crore)MetricJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025Revenue2,105.942,003.762,061.011,968.862,407.96Net Profit73.0171.6146.6663.3373.40EPS1.621.391.061.391.55Balance Sheet Overview The company’s balance sheet indicates a strong asset base. Total assets stood at Rs 7,115 crore as of March 2025, up from Rs 4,763 crore in March 2021. Equity and liabilities have also increased, reflecting the company’s growth. Reserves and surplus have grown from Rs 1,426 crore in 2021 to Rs 2,212 crore in 2025. Debt to equity ratio remains stable at 0.11 in 2025. Cash Flow Analysis Thomas Cook India’s cash flow from operating activities was Rs 717 crore in March 2025, compared to -Rs 581 crore in March 2021, showing improved operational efficiency. Net cash flow has also improved, reaching Rs 209 crore in March 2025. This indicates a positive trend in the company's liquidity and financial health. Overall, the dividend announcement, coupled with the company's positive financial trajectory, could attract investor attention. Shareholders should note the upcoming ex-date to determine their eligibility for the dividend payout.

title: Hindalco shares fall 1.04% on Tuesday, among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Hindalco ended lower in Tuesday's session. The stock was among the top losers on the Nifty 50. At yesterday's close, Hindalco stock was at Rs 706.70 on the NSE, a fall of 1.04% for the day. Financial Snapshot Hindalco has demonstrated substantial financial growth over the past few years. The consolidated annual revenue has increased consistently, reaching Rs 238,496 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 215,962 Crore in March 2024. Net profit also saw a significant rise, from Rs 10,153 Crore in 2024 to Rs 15,999 Crore in 2025. The company's Earnings Per Share (EPS) improved from Rs 45.71 to Rs 72.05 over the same period. For the quarter-ending June 2025, Hindalco reported a consolidated revenue of Rs 64,232 Crore and a net profit of Rs 4,002 Crore, compared to a revenue of Rs 64,890 Crore and a net profit of Rs 5,284 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. Balance Sheet Hindalco’s balance sheet shows a strong financial position. title: Hyundai Motor shares jump 6.5% on Tuesday, among top gainers on Nifty Next 50

title: Shree Cements shares fall 1.39% on Tuesday, among top losers on Nifty Next 50
content: Shares of Shree Cements ended lower in Tuesday's session, with the stock closing at Rs 30,905. This represents a 1.39% decline, positioning the stock among the top losers on the Nifty Next 50 yesterday. The company has seen varied financial performance in recent periods. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 5,280.88 Crore, up from Rs 5,123.96 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 643.66 Crore, significantly higher than the Rs 278.45 Crore reported in June 2024. The earnings per share (EPS) also increased to Rs 178.12 in June 2025, compared to Rs 77.22 in June 2024. Here is a detailed look at Shree Cements' quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 5,123.96 CroreRs 4,054.17 CroreRs 4,572.68 CroreRs 5,532.02 CroreRs 5,280.88 CroreNet ProfitRs 278.45 CroreRs 76.64 CroreRs 193.72 CroreRs 574.99 CroreRs 643.66 CroreEPS77.2221.1853.61159.17178.12The yearly financial performance shows a fluctuating trend. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 19,282.83 Crore, a decrease from Rs 20,520.98 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 1,123.80 Crore, a significant drop from Rs 2,396.16 Crore in March 2024. The EPS also declined to Rs 311.18 in March 2025, compared to Rs 663.98 in March 2024. Below is a summary of the company's yearly financial data:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 13,476.33 CroreRs 15,009.56 CroreRs 17,852.33 CroreRs 20,520.98 CroreRs 19,282.83 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,289.59 CroreRs 2,336.61 CroreRs 1,269.14 CroreRs 2,396.16 CroreRs 1,123.80 CroreEPS633.54646.31352.18663.98311.18BVPS4,281.754,853.265,176.545,749.465,969.44ROE14.8413.356.8111.575.21Debt to Equity0.120.120.140.070.04Shree Cements has announced several corporate actions. The company reaffirmed its credit ratings with CARE Ratings Limited, as per an announcement on August 19, 2025. Additionally, the Income Tax Department's re-assessment proceedings for FY 2016-17 & 2017-18 were quashed by the Hon'ble High Court of Rajasthan, as disclosed on August 12, 2025. The company also published newspaper advertisements for the publication of financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, on August 5, 2025. The company has also declared dividends. A final dividend of Rs 60 per share (600%) was announced on May 14, 2025, with an effective date of July 21, 2025. An interim dividend of Rs 50 per share (500%) was announced on January 30, 2025, with an effective date of February 5, 2025. With the stock's closing price at Rs 30,905 on Tuesday, Shree Cements was among the top losers on the Nifty Next 50.

title: Larsen & Toubro shares decline 0.61% on Tuesday
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro closed at Rs 3,613.00 in Tuesday's session, a 0.61% decrease. The stock's performance reflects trading activity at the end of the previous day, with a high of Rs 3,654.00 and a low of Rs 3,608.20. Here's a look at the financial performance of Larsen & Toubro: Consolidated Quarterly Performance: The following table summarizes the consolidated quarterly financial performance of Larsen & Toubro:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 55,119.82 CroreRs 61,554.58 CroreRs 64,667.78 CroreRs 74,392.28 CroreRs 63,678.92 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,440.11 CroreRs 4,112.81 CroreRs 4,001.03 CroreRs 6,133.44 CroreRs 4,325.57 CroreEPS20.2624.6924.4339.9826.30The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,678.92 Crore, compared to Rs 55,119.82 Crore in June 2024, marking an increase. The net profit for the same period was Rs 4,325.57 Crore, up from Rs 3,440.11 Crore in the previous year. The EPS also increased from 20.26 to 26.30. title: Hindustan Aeronautics shares fall 1.37% on Tuesday, among top losers on Nifty Next 50
content: Shares of Hindustan Aeronautics ended lower in Tuesday's session. The stock was among the top losers on the Nifty Next 50 yesterday, falling 1.37% to Rs 4,452.60. Financial Performance: Hindustan Aeron's financial performance shows consistent growth over the past few years. The consolidated annual revenue has increased steadily, reaching Rs 30,980.95 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 22,754.54 Crore in March 2021. Net profit also saw a significant rise, from Rs 3,234.25 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 8,323.40 Crore in March 2025. The company’s earnings per share (EPS) stood at Rs 125.07 in March 2025. Additionally, the company had a stock split on June 27, 2023, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 5, with an ex-split date of September 28, 2023. Market Sentiment: Recent Moneycontrol analysis indicates a bearish sentiment on the stock as of August 13, 2025. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 4,452.60, Hindustan Aeronautics saw a decline in Tuesday's session, making it among the top losers on the Nifty Next 50.

title: Sensex, Nifty set to snap 4-day gaining streak; key levels to track on August 20
content: Nifty and Sensex are set for a soft start on Wednesday as profit-booking at higher levels threatens to cool the market’s four-day winning streak. At 8:20 am, Gift Nifty hinted at a muted open, trading at 24,966, down 45 points or 0.18 percent. Indian equities surged on August 19, notched a fourth straight day of gains on August 19, powered by strong rallies in auto, oil & gas, metal, and FMCG stocks. The cheer spread across the board, with mid and smallcaps stealing the spotlight as they outpaced the frontline indices. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Foreign investors (FIIs/FPIs) turned net sellers again on Tuesday, after a day of buying, offloading Indian equities worth Rs 634 crore. Domestic institutional investors (DIIs), meanwhile, sustained their support with net purchases of Rs 2,261 crore, according to provisional exchange data. Here are the key levels to watch out for in today's session Nifty continues to demonstrate strength while holding above its gap support near 24,800. A sustained breakout above 25,050 could unleash strong bullish momentum, as significant call writers risk being trapped, leading to potential short covering. On the downside, any dip towards the 24,750 zone is likely to be absorbed as an accumulation opportunity. Robust positioning by Put writers at near-the-money strikes further reinforces this constructive view. Only a decisive breach below 24,700 would warrant caution; until then, the bulls are expected to maintain control. For now, a “buy on dips” strategy remains the most prudent approach, with traders closely watching for a decisive breakout to resolve the current consolidation phase. "While the Nifty Bank index has managed to sustain higher levels, private sector banks are yet to exhibit decisive strength, leading to choppy momentum. The immediate roadblock remains at 56,000–56,100, and only a breakout above this zone would unleash strong bullish momentum through short-covering activity," Dhupesh Dhameja of SAMCO Securities said. "On the downside, dips towards 55,500 remain attractive for accumulation as Put writers continue building positions at near-the-money strikes. A breach below 55,450 would be the first sign of weakness, but until then, bulls are likely to retain control. In the current scenario, a “buy-on-dips” strategy remains prudent, with traders closely monitoring the 56,100 level for a breakout that could potentially resolve the ongoing consolidation phase," he added. India VIX fell sharply by 4.46 percent to close at 11.79. Despite lingering global headwinds, volatility remains subdued, reflecting expectations of consolidation rather than a steep correction. This indicates cautious optimism among market participants without evident signs of fear. The Put-Call Ratio (PCR) has risen from 0.85 to 1.11, underlining the strengthening grip of put writers at current levels. The increasing PCR, or being higher than 0.7 or surpassing 1, means traders are selling more Put options than Call options, which generally indicates the firming up of a bullish sentiment in the market. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: "While the Nifty Bank index has managed to sustain higher levels, private sector banks are yet to exhibit decisive strength, leading to choppy momentum.
summary_luhn: For now, a “buy on dips” strategy remains the most prudent approach, with traders closely watching for a decisive breakout to resolve the current consolidation phase.
summary_lsa: Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Foreign investors (FIIs/FPIs) turned net sellers again on Tuesday, after a day of buying, offloading Indian equities worth Rs 634 crore.
summary_textrank: The increasing PCR, or being higher than 0.7 or surpassing 1, means traders are selling more Put options than Call options, which generally indicates the firming up of a bullish sentiment in the market.

title: Motherson Sumi Wiring stock jumps 6.2% on Tuesday, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Motherson Sumi Wiring India gained in Tuesday's trading session, and were among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The stock ended up 6.16 percent yesterday, with its price at Rs 41.89. Regarding the company's financial performance, Motherson SWI has demonstrated consistent growth in its annual sales over the past five years. For the year-ending March 2025, the company's standalone sales stood at Rs 9,319 Crore, compared to Rs 8,328 Crore in March 2024 and Rs 7,057 Crore in March 2023. The company's total income for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 9,332 Crore, an increase from Rs 8,335 Crore in March 2024. Total expenditure for the same period was Rs 8,502 Crore. The company's earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT) for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 830 Crore, while net profit stood at Rs 605 Crore. The quarterly performance shows sales of Rs 2,494 Crore for June 2025, compared to Rs 2,509 Crore for March 2025, Rs 2,300 Crore for December 2024, Rs 2,325 Crore for September 2024, and Rs 2,184 Crore for June 2024. The net profit for June 2025 was Rs 143 Crore. Motherson SWI's balance sheet highlights that as of March 2025, the company's share capital was Rs 442 Crore, with reserves and surplus amounting to Rs 1,256 Crore. Current liabilities stood at Rs 1,806 Crore, and other liabilities were Rs 223 Crore, bringing the total liabilities to Rs 3,728 Crore. On the assets side, fixed assets amounted to Rs 727 Crore, current assets were Rs 2,853 Crore, and other assets totaled Rs 148 Crore, resulting in total assets of Rs 3,728 Crore. Key financial ratios for Motherson SWI as of March 2025 include a basic and diluted EPS of Rs 1.37. The book value per share was Rs 3.84, and the dividend per share was Rs 0.85. The company’s gross profit margin was 10.82%, operating margin was 8.90%, and net profit margin was 6.50%. The return on net worth was 35.67%, ROCE was 43.19%, and return on assets was 16.24%. The current ratio stood at 1.58, and the quick ratio was 0.87. The debt to equity ratio was 0.01, and the interest coverage ratio was 40.85. The price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio was 25.36, and the price-to-book (P/B) ratio was 13.55. The company has announced several corporate actions. On May 9, 2025, a final dividend of Rs 0.35 per share (35%) was announced, effective June 23, 2025. An interim dividend of Rs 0.50 per share (50%) was announced on March 21, 2025, effective March 28, 2025. The company also announced a bonus issue on May 29, 2025, with an existing ratio of 2:1 and an ex-bonus date of July 18, 2025. Motherson SWI ended up 6.16 percent in Tuesday's session, with its price at Rs 41.89.

title: Kalyan Jewellers shares fall 2.47% on Tuesday, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Kalyan Jewellers declined 2.47% on Tuesday to end at Rs 507.35, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 in yesterday's trading session. Financial Performance: Kalyan Jewellers' financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the past few years. The company has demonstrated strong financial results, as highlighted below: Consolidated Yearly Performance: The consolidated yearly performance of Kalyan Jeweller reveals significant growth trends.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 8,573.31 CroreRs 10,817.93 CroreRs 14,071.45 CroreRs 18,548.29 CroreRs 25,045.07 CroreNet Profit-Rs 6.07 CroreRs 224.03 CroreRs 431.93 CroreRs 596.29 CroreRs 714.17 CroreEPS-Rs 0.07Rs 2.18Rs 4.20Rs 5.80Rs 6.93BVPSRs 27.44Rs 30.46Rs 35.28Rs 40.66Rs 46.57ROE-Rs 0.22Rs 7.14Rs 11.91Rs 14.25Rs 14.88Debt to EquityRs 1.14Rs 1.07Rs 0.97Rs 0.79Rs 0.69The revenue has increased significantly from Rs 8,573.31 Crore in 2021 to Rs 25,045.07 Crore in 2025. Net profit has also shown substantial improvement, from a loss of Rs 6.07 Crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 714.17 Crore in 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) have risen from -Rs 0.07 in 2021 to Rs 6.93 in 2025. Consolidated Quarterly Performance: The consolidated quarterly performance provides insights into recent financial trends.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 5,535.48 CroreRs 6,065.48 CroreRs 7,286.88 CroreRs 6,181.53 CroreRs 7,268.48 CroreNet ProfitRs 177.56 CroreRs 130.33 CroreRs 218.68 CroreRs 187.61 CroreRs 264.08 CroreEPSRs 1.73Rs 1.27Rs 2.12Rs 1.82Rs 2.56Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 7,268.48 Crore, up from Rs 5,535.48 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 264.08 Crore, compared to Rs 177.56 Crore in the same quarter last year. The EPS increased from Rs 1.73 in June 2024 to Rs 2.56 in June 2025.
