title: Voltas shares gain 2% in Tuesday's trading session; among top performers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: In Tuesday's trading session, Voltas shares experienced a notable increase, climbing 2% to reach Rs 1,376.20. This positive movement reflects a significant rise compared to its previous closing price. As of 2:40 pm on the NSE, Voltas was trading with positive momentum. The stock is currently positioned among the top-performing stocks on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Recent analysis by Moneycontrol, conducted on August 18, 2025, suggests a bullish outlook for Voltas. In corporate action, the company announced the audio recording of the Q1 FY26 Earnings Conference Call held on August 8, 2025, is available on the Company's website. Earlier, the company had also released investor presentation and press release. Voltas has a history of dividend payouts. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 7 per share (700%) on May 7, 2025, with an effective date of June 20, 2025. Prior to this, a final dividend of Rs 5.50 per share (550%) was announced on May 7, 2024, effective from June 25, 2024. The company had also announced final dividends of Rs 4.25, Rs 5.50 and Rs 5 per share in the years 2023, 2022 and 2021 respectively. The company has also issued bonus shares and rights issues in the past. The most recent bonus issue was announced on January 30, 1989, with a bonus ratio of 1:2. A rights issue was announced on September 30, 1992, with a rights ratio of 1:2. Voltas also underwent stock splits. The face value of the company’s shares was split from Rs 10 to Rs 1 on May 11, 2006, and earlier from Rs 100 to Rs 10 on January 3, 1996. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,376.20, Voltas has demonstrated a steady climb throughout today's session.
summary_lexrank: Prior to this, a final dividend of Rs 5.50 per share (550%) was announced on May 7, 2024, effective from June 25, 2024.
summary_luhn: The face value of the company’s shares was split from Rs 10 to Rs 1 on May 11, 2006, and earlier from Rs 100 to Rs 10 on January 3, 1996.
summary_lsa: With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,376.20, Voltas has demonstrated a steady climb throughout today's session.

title: Bharat Dynamics, GRSE, HAL, other defence stocks drop up to 3% after Trump-Zelenskyy meet
content: The shares of defence companies dropped on August 19 as expectations of a ceasefire between Russia and Ukraine increased after US President Donald Trump met Volodymyr Zelenskyy in the White House. The sharp fall in the share prices pushed the Nifty India Defence index down nearly a percent to hover around 7,742 in the afternoon. Trump hosted Ukraine's President Zelenskyy and a group of European allies at the White House, following his meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday in Alaska. In a social media post late on Monday, Trump said he had called the Russian leader and begun arranging a meeting between Putin and Zelenskyy, which was to be followed by a trilateral summit among the three presidents. Trump told reporters in the Oval Office that he liked the concept of a ceasefire but the two sides could work on a peace deal while the fighting continued. "I wish they could stop, I'd like them to stop," he said. #InPics | U.S. President Donald Trump meets with Ukrainian President Zelensky and European leaders, in Washington, D.C.#DonaldTrump #Zelensky #Ukraine #US #Russia pic.twitter.com/ADdycQPE1U — Moneycontrol (@moneycontrolcom) August 19, 2025 The possibility of easing global geopolitical tensions may have impacted the Indian defence stocks, which have seen a massive decline from record peaks amid concerns over stretched valuations and lack of fresh triggers. Bharat Dynamics (BDL) shares dropped nearly 3 percent to trade at Rs 1,559 apiece. Data Patterns shares followed, dropping more than 2 percent. Solar Industries, Garden Reach Shipbuilders and Engineers (GRSE) and Hindustan Aeronautics (HAL) shares declined more than 1 percent each. Bharat Electronics (BEL), Cochin Shipyard and Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders shares were hovering in the red with marginal losses. Bucking the trend, BEML and Paras Defence shares were trading in the green with marginal gains. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Sebi mulls double-edged move: Higher intraday limits, with expiry-day clampdown and penalties for breach
content: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) is weighing a review of intraday position limits in index options, especially with a focus on reining in excessive trading on expiry days, Moneycontrol has learnt from people familiar with development who requested not to be named. At present, there is no limit for intraday positions, however, exchanges monitor intraday limits at the same thresholds as end-of-day for index options, Rs 1,500 crore on a net delta (futures-equivalent) basis and Rs 10,000 crore on a gross basis. However, Sebi’s examination of recent expiry-day data in Nifty and Sensex contracts showed that positions routinely breached these levels during intraday trade. On the August 7 expiry, for example, the top net long and short positions in Nifty touched Rs 4,245 crore and Rs 5,409 crore, respectively, while gross positions exceeded Rs 10192 crore (long) and Rs 11,777 crore (short). Similarly, on August 5 Sensex expiry day, the top net long position was Rs 2249 crore and top net short position was Rs 3055 crore. Top gross long position was Rs 11,831 crore and top gross short position was Rs 9647 crore. In this backdrop, Sebi is considering increasing the intraday monitoring threshold to Rs 5,000 crore, while keeping the Rs 10,000-crore gross ceiling unchanged. The move follows the regulator’s February 2025 consultation paper that had proposed higher intraday thresholds but was withdrawn in favour of tighter surveillance. Sebi noted that since positions expiring on expiry day do not reflect in end-of-day (EoD) data, intraday monitoring becomes crucial to detect oversized exposures. “The regulatory intent of rationalizing expiry-day hyperactivity while limiting risks associated with large, outsized positions favours stipulating limits for intraday index options positions,” the regulator observed. Though regulator has clarified that additional positions backed by cash, cash equivalents, or securities holdings will be permitted. Also Read: Sebi panel on Takeover Regulations reviews definition of control, no tweaks to open offer and creeping acquisition threshold The latest framework proposes distinguishing between expiry and non-expiry days. On non-expiry days, breaches would only trigger exchange-level scrutiny. On expiry days, however, violations would attract penalties. Exchanges will also be required to monitor intraday positions at four random intervals daily, with at least one check close to market close. Also Read: Sebi proposes less stake dilution, more timeline for public shareholding compliance for large IPOs The issue has been actively discussed with stock exchanges, brokers, and other market participants. SEBI’s proposal seeks to strike a balance between maintaining market integrity and ensuring that liquidity providers and market makers—who often square off intraday positions—are not unduly constrained. Sebi had earlier prescribed a glide path for position limits in index options up to December 5, 2025, allowing participants time to build delta-monitoring systems. With systems expected to be in place by December 6, Sebi plans to operationalize the intraday monitoring framework from that date. By reintroducing intraday limits with sharper surveillance, Sebi aims to address systemic risks, safeguard market integrity, and rein in volatility, particularly on expiry days when speculative activity often peaks. An email seeking comments from Sebi on proposed move did not elicit any response.
summary_lexrank: At present, there is no limit for intraday positions, however, exchanges monitor intraday limits at the same thresholds as end-of-day for index options, Rs 1,500 crore on a net delta (futures-equivalent) basis and Rs 10,000 crore on a gross basis.
summary_luhn: On the August 7 expiry, for example, the top net long and short positions in Nifty touched Rs 4,245 crore and Rs 5,409 crore, respectively, while gross positions exceeded Rs 10192 crore (long) and Rs 11,777 crore (short).
summary_lsa: By reintroducing intraday limits with sharper surveillance, Sebi aims to address systemic risks, safeguard market integrity, and rein in volatility, particularly on expiry days when speculative activity often peaks.
summary_textrank: On the August 7 expiry, for example, the top net long and short positions in Nifty touched Rs 4,245 crore and Rs 5,409 crore, respectively, while gross positions exceeded Rs 10192 crore (long) and Rs 11,777 crore (short).

title: Newly-listed stocks rally: JSW Cement, Brigade Hotel Ventures, Crizac shares jump up to 7%
content: The shares of JSW Cement, Brigade Hotel Ventures and Crizac sharply gained on August 19. This comes amid a broader uptrend in the stock market. The sharp rise in the share prices comes weeks after three stocks debuted on Dalal Street. Brigade Hotel Ventures share price: Brigade Hotel Ventures shares jumped more than 7 percent to hit an intraday high of Rs 92 apiece. This is the highest level seen by the stock so far. Brigade Hotel Ventures shares have gained nearly 8 percent since listing, and are currently up 2 percent from its IPO price. The stock had made a weak market debut on July 31, listing at Rs 81.10 apiece on NSE. This marks a discount of nearly 10 percent over the IPO price of Rs 90 per share. The Rs 760-crore IPO of Brigade Hotel Ventures was subscribed nearly 4.5 times during its three days of public bidding. Retail investors led the subscription race, booking their reserved portion over 6 times. Crizac share price: Crizac shares jumped more than 6 percent to hit an intraday high of Rs 337 apiece, snapping a two-day losing streak. The shares of the company have surged nearly 20 percent from its listing price, and are up more than 37 percent from the IPO price. Crizac shares had listed at Rs 281 apiece on NSE on July 9, marking a premium of nearly 15 percent over its IPO price of Rs 245 apiece. The Rs 860-crore IPO of Crizac saw strong investor interest during its three days of public bidding. The maiden public issue of the Kolkata-based education company was subscribed 59.82 times between July 2 and July 4. JSW Cement share price: JSW Cement shares jumped more than 5 percent to hit an intraday high of Rs 158 apiece. The stock has so far increased 3 percent from its listing price, and nearly 8 percent from its IPO price within three sessions of being listed on the stock market. The shares of the company had listed at Rs 153.5 per share on NSE on August 14, marking a 4 percent premium over the IPO price of Rs 147 per share. Motilal Oswal has initiated coverage on the stock with a 'Neutral' rating with a target price of Rs 163 per share, calling the stock 'fairly valued'. title: Sensex up 500 pts, Nifty at 25,000 as auto, oil & gas stocks rally; RIL up over 2%
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex powered ahead in afternoon trade on August 19, with all sectors flashing green and volatility edging lower. Mid- and small-cap stocks outshone the frontline peers, extending their winning streak, and if the momentum holds, the market is on track to notch up a fourth straight day of gains. At about 12:40 pm, the Sensex was up 462.90 points or 0.57 percent at 81,736.65, and the Nifty was up 123.55 points or 0.50 percent at 25,000.50. About 2287 shares advanced, 1265 shares declined, and 113 shares remained unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates At midday on August 19, Indian markets were trading higher with broad-based gains across sectors. The Nifty Auto index led the charge, rising 1.2 percent, while Nifty Oil & Gas advanced 1.3 percent and Nifty Infra gained 0.7 percent. Media, energy, metals and IT also added between 0.3 and 1 percent. Among financials, Nifty Bank inched up 0.3 percent, supported by gains of 0.5 percent in PSU banks and 0.4 percent in private banks. FMCG and consumer durables traded marginally in the green. Realty and mid- and small-cap indices also moved higher. Meanwhile, India VIX fell 3.7 percent, reflecting easing volatility. Auto stocks were the bright sparks in today's session and rallied up to 6 percent after fresh signals out of New Delhi. According to CNBC TV-18, China’s foreign minister, currently in India for meetings, has assured that Beijing will address key concerns flagged by New Delhi, including the supply of rare earth magnets — a critical input for automakers — and tunnel boring machines. Ola Electric and Tata Motors were the top gainers. Also read: Centre moving quickly on deregulation norms to enhance ease of business for India Inc Reliance Industries shares rose more than 2 percent in Tuesday’s trade after its Jio telecom unit announced changes in its prepaid tariffs. The gains were supported by upbeat brokerage commentary. Reliance Jio has discontinued its entry-level 1GB per day prepaid packs priced at Rs 209 for 22 days and Rs 249 for 28 days. Brokerage IIFL said the Rs 249 pack contributed less than 10 percent to Jio’s mobile revenues, and the 20 percent hike could directly lift overall revenue by under 2 percent. Axis Capital, however, expects the tariff changes to boost Jio’s FY26E revenue. Shares of Inox Wind rose as much as 6 percent after the company said it had divested a stake worth about Rs 175 crore in its subsidiary Inox Renewable Solutions Ltd. (IRSL). The company disclosed in a regulatory filing that it has signed agreements, last executed on August 18, to sell 49.6 lakh equity shares of IRSL, each with a face value of Rs 10. The transaction values the subsidiary at around Rs 7,400 crore, with the sale expected to be completed within the next seven days. Read more: Vardhman Textiles, Ambika Cotton Mills & other cotton stocks rally as Centre scraps import duty Technical View "The near-term outlook for the market remains positive, with traders advised to adopt a buy-on-dips, sell-on-rallies approach. For the Nifty, support is placed at 24,750–24,700, with a stop loss at 24,600. On the upside, resistance is seen at 25,000 and 25,100," Shrikant Chouhan, Head Equity Research at Kotak Securities, said. "For the Bank Nifty, support lies in the 55,500–55,350 zone. Buying opportunities are expected near 55,350 with a stop loss at 55,000, while resistance levels are pegged at 55,850 and 56,100," he added. Tata Motors, Reliance Industries, Adani Ports, Bajaj Auto, and Adani Enterprises were the top gainers on the Nifty. Laggards on the index included Grasim, Bajaj Finserv, Hindalco, Power Grid Corp, and Bajaj Finance. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Disclaimer: Moneycontrol is a part of the Network18 group. Network18 is controlled by Independent Media Trust, of which Reliance Industries is the sole beneficiary.
summary_lexrank: For the Nifty, support is placed at 24,750–24,700, with a stop loss at 24,600.
summary_luhn: At about 12:40 pm, the Sensex was up 462.90 points or 0.57 percent at 81,736.65, and the Nifty was up 123.55 points or 0.50 percent at 25,000.50.
summary_lsa: Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates At midday on August 19, Indian markets were trading higher with broad-based gains across sectors.
summary_textrank: Mid- and small-cap stocks outshone the frontline peers, extending their winning streak, and if the momentum holds, the market is on track to notch up a fourth straight day of gains.

title: Cement stocks may be on fire in FY26; GST rate cut buzz fuels fresh rally hopes
content: Cement stocks are having a solid run in FY26 — and the momentum may just be getting started. A mix of steady price hikes, strong Q1 volumes, and earnings beats has already lit up the sector. Now, chatter around a possible GST rate cut from 28 percent to 18 percent has thrown in a new catalyst, stoking bullish bets that the cement rally could shift into an even higher gear. Analysts said lower taxes could drive up demand, expand margins, and even trigger a sector re-rating at a time when consolidation and M&A activity are altering the industry dynamic. In a market that is starved of potential re-rating candidate because of elevated valuations, analysts said the boring cement sector could actually turn out to be the exciting performer. Why GST relief matters Analysts at ICICI Securities said that if the GST rate on cement is reduced from the existing 28 percent to 18 percent, the impact on profitability could be meaningful. They estimated every 1 percent change in realisation can translate into a 3-5 percent impact on EBITDA, providing a significant cushion to margins across the industry. "The industry will have to pass on the rate cut benefit to consumers but overtime the prices are expected to inch up due to changing market dynamics," they added, citing Ultratech Cement as their preferred pick from the space. Since the inception of the GST regime, cement has been placed in the highest tax slab of 28 percent, unlike other construction inputs such as metals, tiles, and sanitary ware, which are taxed at a relatively lower rate of 18 percent. Analysts at Choice Broking explained that moving cement into the 18 percent bracket could trigger a dual advantage. First, it would help boost consumption and, second, it would gradually improve capacity utilisation and pricing power of manufacturers. They projected industry demand, which has historically been in the range of 6-8 percent for FY27/FY28E, could rise to 8-10 percent under an 18 percent GST rate scenario. Additionally, they foresee a pricing tailwind of Rs 60-100 per tonne for FY27/28E. The brokerage also expects EBITDA per tonne to improve meaningfully. They estimated gains in the range of 15-25 percent for FY27/28E, with ACC, Birla Corporation, and JK Lakshmi Cement likely to emerge as the biggest beneficiaries, potentially offering an upside of as much as 30 percent in these counters. Stocks, MFs join the party In terms of stock performance, cement stocks have been among the top gainers of FY26. JK Cement has led the pack with a robust 50 percent rally, followed by Nuvoco Vistas, Star Cement, India Cements, and Ramco Cements, which gained between 20 percent and 45 percent. Among the larger players, however, performance was mixed: Ambuja Cements delivered a modest 8 percent return, while ACC slipped 6 percent. The sector has also drawn strong interest from domestic mutual funds. Data showed that 8 out of the top 10 cement companies saw an increase in mutual fund holdings during the June quarter compared with the same period last year, underlining institutional confidence in the space. Q1 performance gives cement its backbone The strength of the June quarter earnings has provided further validation. Nuvoco Vistas reported a stunning 4,589 percent year-on-year jump in PAT, reaching Rs 133 crore, driven by improved operational efficiencies and better price realisations. Star Cement delivered a 217 percent surge in profit. Ambuja Cements maintained its solid footing with 22.6 percent sales growth and 24 percent profit growth, while JK Cement continued its strong performance with 19.4 percent sales growth and an impressive 75 percent rise in PAT. At the top of the table, Ultratech Cement, the industry leader, posted the highest revenue at Rs 21,275 crore, with sales growth of 13 percent and a 49 percent jump in PAT to Rs 2,225 crore. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: As 'fairly valued' JSW Cement leverages group’s steel output, Motilal Oswal initiates coverage
content: Shares of recently-listed JSW Cement are higher by over 3 percent on August 19, with brokerage Motilal Oswal initiating coverage with a 'Neutral' rating with a target price of Rs 163 per share, calling the stock 'fairly valued'. The note projects an FY26 profit of around Rs 300 crore for JSW Cement, with a revenue CAGR of 19 percent over FY25-28, and EBITDA CAGR of 31 percent for the same period. Unlike other cement players that have dominance in the grey cement category, JSW Cement has a higher concentration of revenue and profit from ground granulated blast furnace slag (GGBS), which is manufactured from slag, and is a byproduct of the steel-making process. Leveraging JSW Group’s presence in steel manufacturing, JSW Cement has emerged as the largest manufacturer of GGBS in India with a market share of close to 84 percent. Motilal Oswal said JSW Cement is 'well-positioned' to capitalize on the rising demand for GGBS, and is supported by long-term supply agreements for blast furnace slag. According to the MOSL note, GGBS made up around 34 percent of JSW Cement's total revenue for FY25, and its share in EBITDA was higher at 76 percent for FY25. The ongoing expansion plans at JSW Cement will soon see the company foray into the North region, where MOSL said profitability is 'better' compared to South India. "It will also help JSW Cement reduce its capacity concentration in the South region to around 41 percent by FY28e from around 53 percent in FY25," said MOSL. However, this capex will keep the debt levels at JSW Cement elevated, said the note. "We estimate a capex of Rs 5,600 crore during FY26-28e, which would be mainly for the Rajasthan integrated unit. The remaining capex will be used for a grinding unit of Shiva Cement, a greenfield unit in Punjab and brownfield capacity expansion in the south region," MOSL said. JSW Cement could see an improvement in its clinker-to-cement conversion for existing plants, along with higher-than-estimated GGBS volumes and better utilization for the North India plant, said MOSL, while pointing at a downside risk of lower trade volume, pricing pressure in South and delays in capacity commissioning in North India. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: "It will also help JSW Cement reduce its capacity concentration in the South region to around 41 percent by FY28e from around 53 percent in FY25," said MOSL.
summary_luhn: The note projects an FY26 profit of around Rs 300 crore for JSW Cement, with a revenue CAGR of 19 percent over FY25-28, and EBITDA CAGR of 31 percent for the same period.
summary_lsa: "We estimate a capex of Rs 5,600 crore during FY26-28e, which would be mainly for the Rajasthan integrated unit.
summary_textrank: Unlike other cement players that have dominance in the grey cement category, JSW Cement has a higher concentration of revenue and profit from ground granulated blast furnace slag (GGBS), which is manufactured from slag, and is a byproduct of the steel-making process.

title: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation shares rise 2.07%
content: Shares of Hindustan Petroleum Corporation were trading higher in Tuesday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 395.05, a 2.07% increase from the previous close at 11:05 am. The stock is part of the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. Recent Financial Performance: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation's consolidated financial performance reveals the following trends: Quarterly Results: In the quarter ending June 2025, the company's revenue stood at Rs 110,825.33 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 113,888.28 Crore reported in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 4,222.21 Crore, significantly higher than the Rs 245.86 Crore reported in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS stood at Rs 19.32 in June 2025, compared to Rs 2.98 in June 2024. Annual Results: For the year ending March 2025, Hindustan Petroleum Corporation reported a revenue of Rs 434,106.17 Crore, slightly up from Rs 433,856.51 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year stood at Rs 6,855.29 Crore, a decrease compared to the Rs 14,206.63 Crore reported in the previous year. The EPS for the year was Rs 31.66, lower than the Rs 112.89 reported in March 2024.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)2021233,248.4510,524.2370.572022349,913.185,836.1851.362023440,709.25-9,471.74-49.212024433,856.5114,206.63112.892025434,106.176,855.2931.66The company's sales increased from Rs 233,248 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 434,106 Crore in March 2025. Key financial ratios for Hindustan Petroleum Corporation show a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.30 as of the year-ending March 2025. Further, the P/E (x) is 11.38 and P/B (x) is 1.50 as of March 2025. Corporate Actions: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation has a history of bonus issues, including a 1:2 bonus ratio with an ex-bonus date of June 21, 2024. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 10.50 per share (105%) with an effective date of August 14, 2025. title: Container Corporation of India shares rise 2.03%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Container Corporation of India shares are trading higher at Rs 548.70, marking a 2.03% increase from the previous close in Tuesday's session at 11:05 am. The stock is among the top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150. Financial Snapshot: A review of Container Corporation of India's financial performance reveals the following: The consolidated quarterly financial results show a fluctuating pattern in revenue and net profit. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 2,153.63 Crore, slightly higher than the Rs 2,103.13 Crore recorded in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 259.13 Crore, a marginal decrease compared to Rs 260.24 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The annual financial results provide a broader view of the company's performance. Revenue has steadily increased over the years, from Rs 6,427.08 Crore in 2021 to Rs 8,887.02 Crore in 2025. Similarly, net profit has grown from Rs 469.30 Crore in 2021 to Rs 1,259.70 Crore in 2025. title: Ola Electric, Tata Motors, Bajaj Auto rally up to 6% as China assures addressing rare earth magnet crunch
content: Indian auto shares extended gains on Tuesday, with Ola Electric, Bajaj Auto, Hero MotoCorp, Hyundai Motor, Eicher Motors and Maruti Suzuki rising up to 6 percent in trade. The Nifty Auto index advanced 1 percent, buiglding on Monday’s near 5 percent jump after reports that the government may cut GST on vehicles to spur demand. The rally also found support from fresh signals out of New Delhi. According to CNBC TV-18, China’s foreign minister, currently in India for meetings, has assured that Beijing will address key concerns flagged by New Delhi, including the supply of rare earth magnets — a critical input for automakers — and tunnel boring machines. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates For auto manufacturers, the rare earth issue has been particularly acute. China accounts for about 90 percent of global production and supply, and shortages have already disrupted output. Bajaj Auto slashed production of its electric two-wheelers by as much as 50 percent in July, warning that volumes in August and September will also remain constrained. Hero MotoCorp, on its Q1FY26 earnings call, admitted the shortage is an industry-wide challenge but said it has secured enough supplies to cover both its internal combustion engine and electric vehicle models through the second quarter of FY26. The company added that key components such as EV motors and engine and wheel sensors, which rely heavily on rare earth magnets, are covered for now, while it continues to explore long-term alternatives. Tata Motors, India’s largest EV player, has also flagged rare earth magnets as a potential choke point. While its production has not been hit yet, the company is already working on alternative supply options to secure future operations. If Beijing’s assurances materialise, automakers could find much-needed relief from supply disruptions that have threatened production schedules, even as domestic demand prospects brighten with talk of a potential GST cut. At about 10:55 am, the Nifty Auto index was up 1 percent, with the top gainers being Ola Electric, Bajaj Auto, Tata Motors, Maruti Suzuki, Hero MotoCorp, Eicher Motors, Hyundai Motor India, and TVS Motor Company. The Nifty Auto index is up 11.21 percent since the beginning of the year. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

summary_luhn: At about 10:55 am, the Nifty Auto index was up 1 percent, with the top gainers being Ola Electric, Bajaj Auto, Tata Motors, Maruti Suzuki, Hero MotoCorp, Eicher Motors, Hyundai Motor India, and TVS Motor Company.
summary_lsa: If Beijing’s assurances materialise, automakers could find much-needed relief from supply disruptions that have threatened production schedules, even as domestic demand prospects brighten with talk of a potential GST cut.

title: FACT, RCF, Agro Phos shares rise up to 5% as China may lift curbs on fertiliser exports
content: The shares of fertiliser companies recorded notable gains on August 19 after reports said that Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi has assured to address India's three key concerns - rare-earth magnets, fertilisers and tunnel boring machines. During what is his first visit to India in three years, Wang Yi assured External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar that China is addressing India's needs related to fertilisers, CNBC-TV18 reported citing people familiar with the matter. He further assured that the Xi Jinping-led country will address India's concerns around rare earth magnets and tunnel boring machines, the report added. Another report said that China has already informed India that it is lifting export restrictions on fertilizers, rare earth magnets and tunnel boring machines. According to Economic Times, Yi told Jaishankar that the Chinese officials are working to remove the restrictions. Moneycontrol couldn't independently verify the reports. Agro Phos India shares jumped 5 percent to hit the upper circuit at Rs 38.92 apiece. Southern Petrochemicals and Zuari Agro Chemicals shares gained around 4 percent each. Paradeep Phosphates, Rashtriya Chemicals and Fertilizers (RCF) and Fertilizers and Chemicals Travancore (FACT) shares were up nearly 3 percent each, while Gujarat State Fertilizers & Chemicals, Madras Fertilizers, Mangalore Chemicals & Fertilizers and Chambal Fertilizers shares gained more than 2 percent each. National Fertilizers shares were up over 1 percent. China had withheld shipments of critical fertilisers to India over the recent months. India reportedly imports nearly 80 percent of its specialty fertilisers, such as water-soluble nutrients, liquid foliar feeds, slow- and controlled-release variants, and bio-stimulants, from China. The two foreign ministers met on August 18 in New Delhi, ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s scheduled visit to China to attend the annual summit of Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO). A statement by the Chinese foreign ministry said the country is ready to uphold the principle of cordiality and mutual benefit with India. Wang will also meet Indian National Security Adviser Ajit Doval to discuss the two countries’ border dispute before calling on Prime Minister Narendra Modi later on August 19. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Reliance shares rise nearly 3% on Jio tariff changes, positive brokerage calls
content: Reliance Industries shares rose nearly 3 percent in Tuesday’s trade after its Jio telecom unit announced changes in its prepaid tariffs. The gains were supported by upbeat brokerage commentary. On the NSE, RIL stock rose as much as 2.84 percent to Rs 1,421, extending gains into a second straight session. Reliance Jio has discontinued its entry-level 1GB per day prepaid packs priced at Rs 209 for 22 days and Rs 249 for 28 days. Following the revision, the effective entry plan now begins at Rs 299 for 1.5GB per day for 28 days, up from Rs 249 earlier. The move aligns Jio’s pricing with Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea, which already charge Rs 299 for similar 28-day plans. Brokerage IIFL said the Rs 249 pack contributed less than 10 percent to Jio’s mobile revenues, and the 20 percent hike could directly lift overall revenue by under 2 percent. Axis Capital, however, expects the tariff changes to boost Jio’s FY26E revenue and average revenue per user (ARPU) by 4-5 percent, reported CNBC-TV18. Morgan Stanley said that Jio has removed its popular Rs 249 plan (1GB per day for 28 days) and Rs 199 plan (1.5GB per day for 18 days). With this, the lowest-priced daily data option for 28 days now starts at Rs 299. Domestic brokerages reiterated a ‘Buy’ rating on Reliance with a target price of Rs 1,690. Citi said the SEBI proposal on large IPOs could have meaningful positive implications for a potential Jio listing. Jefferies maintained its ‘Buy’ call with a target price of Rs 1,670, citing improving cash flows in Jio, steady growth in retail and continued investments in renewables in the oil-to-chemicals business. As of 10:30 am, 2.21 lakh shares of Reliance Industries worth Rs 31.06 crore changed hands on the BSE. On the NSE, more than 45 lakh shares were traded till the time of publishing. The company’s market value stood at more than Rs 19.1 lakh crore, according to BSE data. Disclaimer: Moneycontrol is a part of the Network18 group. Network18 is controlled by Independent Media Trust, of which Reliance Industries is the sole beneficiary.
summary_lexrank: As of 10:30 am, 2.21 lakh shares of Reliance Industries worth Rs 31.06 crore changed hands on the BSE.
summary_luhn: Morgan Stanley said that Jio has removed its popular Rs 249 plan (1GB per day for 28 days) and Rs 199 plan (1.5GB per day for 18 days).
summary_lsa: The move aligns Jio’s pricing with Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea, which already charge Rs 299 for similar 28-day plans.
summary_textrank: Brokerage IIFL said the Rs 249 pack contributed less than 10 percent to Jio’s mobile revenues, and the 20 percent hike could directly lift overall revenue by under 2 percent.

title: Hyundai Motor India shares jump 2.96% with high volumes, among top gainers on Nifty Next 50
content: Shares of Hyundai Motor India were trading with a gain of 2.96% at Rs 2,495.10 in Tuesday's session, witnessing high volume. The stock is among the top gainers on Nifty Next 50. On the financial front, Hyundai Motor India has demonstrated strong performance. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 16,412.88 Crore, while the net profit was Rs 1,369.23 Crore and EPS was Rs 16.85. In the previous quarter-ending March 2025, the company reported a consolidated revenue of Rs 17,940.28 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 1,614.35 Crore and EPS of Rs 19.87. Here's a summary of Hyundai Motor India's quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 17,344.23 CroreRs 17,260.38 CroreRs 16,647.99 CroreRs 17,940.28 CroreRs 16,412.88 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,489.65 CroreRs 1,375.47 CroreRs 1,160.73 CroreRs 1,614.35 CroreRs 1,369.23 CroreEPS18.3316.9314.2919.8716.85The annual consolidated financial data reveals consistent growth. The revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 69,192.89 Crore, compared to Rs 69,829.06 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 5,640.21 Crore, while for the year-ending March 2024, it was Rs 6,060.04 Crore. Here's an overview of the company's yearly financial performance:Heading2022202320242025RevenueRs 47,378.43 CroreRs 60,307.58 CroreRs 69,829.06 CroreRs 69,192.89 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,901.59 CroreRs 4,709.25 CroreRs 6,060.04 CroreRs 5,640.21 CroreEPS3,571.005,796.007,458.0069.41BVPS20,745.1024,681.6013,126.30200.56ROE17.2123.4856.8134.61Debt to Equity0.070.060.070.05The company's financial ratios show a positive trend. The debt-to-equity ratio has remained stable, indicating a healthy balance sheet. Key financial ratios for Hyundai Motor India show a P/E ratio of 24.60 and a P/B ratio of 8.51 as of March 2025. For the year-ending March 2025, the basic EPS (Rs.) was 69.41. Also, the company has announced a final dividend of Rs 21 per share. Hyundai Motor India announced a final dividend of Rs 21.00 per share (210%) with the effective date as August 5, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment for Hyundai Motor India as of August 19, 2025.

title: One 97 Communications Paytm shares rise 2.98%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of One 97 Communications Paytm were up 2.98% to Rs 1,208.80 in morning trade. The stock gained following positive investor sentiment, with the scrip trading as one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. On the financial front, One 97 Communications Paytm has demonstrated notable financial activity. The consolidated revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 1,917.50 Crore, an increase compared to Rs 1,501.60 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 122.10 Crore, a turnaround from a loss of Rs 838.80 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS for June 2025 was Rs 1.92, compared to Rs -13.00 in June 2024. Here is a more detailed look at the quarterly financials:ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,501.60 CroreRs 1,659.50 CroreRs 1,827.80 CroreRs 1,911.50 CroreRs 1,917.50 CroreNet ProfitRs -838.80 CroreRs 925.70 CroreRs -208.30 CroreRs -544.30 CroreRs 122.10 CroreEPS-13.0014.59-3.27-8.471.92The company's annual consolidated revenue shows a fluctuating trend over the years. For the year 2025, the revenue stood at Rs 6,900.40 Crore, compared to Rs 9,977.80 Crore in 2024. The net profit also reflects a similar trend, with a net loss of Rs -665.70 Crore in 2025, improving from a loss of Rs -1,384.70 Crore in 2024. The EPS for 2025 was Rs -10.35, compared to Rs -22.00 in 2024. Here is a summary of the key annual financial figures:Particulars20212022202320242025RevenueRs 2,802.40 CroreRs 4,974.20 CroreRs 7,990.30 CroreRs 9,977.80 CroreRs 6,900.40 CroreNet ProfitRs -1,627.00 CroreRs -2,350.50 CroreRs -1,764.00 CroreRs -1,384.70 CroreRs -665.70 CroreEPS-281.16-38.00-27.00-22.00-10.35BVPS1,077.02217.71204.93209.09235.53ROE-25.95-16.90-13.64-10.63-4.38Debt to Equity0.080.000.000.000.00Standalone financial data reveals that sales for March 2025 were Rs 5,504 Crore, compared to Rs 7,660 Crore in March 2024. The net profit was Rs -789 Crore in March 2025, versus Rs -1,476 Crore in March 2024. The cash flow statement shows that the net cash flow for March 2025 was Rs -1,914 Crore, compared to Rs 840 Crore in March 2024. The balance sheet indicates that total liabilities for March 2025 were Rs 17,441 Crore, compared to Rs 14,988 Crore in March 2024. Total assets for the same period were Rs 17,441 Crore, compared to Rs 14,988 Crore in the previous year. Key financial ratios for March 2025 include a basic EPS of Rs -12.39, a book value per share of Rs 201.79, and a P/E ratio of -63.23. The debt-to-equity ratio for March 2025 was 0.00. In corporate action news, Paytm Payments Services Limited (PPSL) received in-principle authorization to operate as an Online Payment Aggregator under The Payment and Settlement Systems Act, 2007, according to an announcement on August 12, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment on the stock as of August 19, 2025.

title: Tata Motors shares gain 3.25%, among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Tata Motors were among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 in Tuesday's trading session. At 10:30 am, the stock was trading at Rs 698.00, a 3.25% increase. Other top gainers on the Nifty 50 included Reliance, Bajaj Auto, Bharti Airtel and Hero Motocorp. Financial Highlights of Tata Motors: The following table summarizes the consolidated financial performance of Tata Motors.ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 108,048.00 CroreRs 101,450.00 CroreRs 113,575.00 CroreRs 119,503.00 CroreRs 104,407.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 5,563.00 CroreRs 3,368.00 CroreRs 5,616.00 CroreRs 8,442.00 CroreRs 3,871.00 CroreEPS14.619.7214.8123.4010.66The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 104,407.00 Crore, compared to Rs 108,048.00 Crore for the quarter ending June 2024. Net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,871.00 Crore, while in June 2024, the net profit was Rs 5,563.00 Crore. The company's EPS stood at 10.66 for the quarter ending June 2025, down from 14.61 in June 2024.Particulars20212022202320242025RevenueRs 249,794.75 CroreRs 278,453.62 CroreRs 345,966.96 CroreRs 437,927.77 CroreRs 439,695.00 CroreNet Profit-Rs 13,016.14 Crore-Rs 11,234.70 CroreRs 2,353.49 CroreRs 31,106.95 CroreRs 22,991.00 CroreEPS-36.99-29.886.2981.9578.80BVPS148.39127.50137.33242.90315.61ROE-24.34-25.675.3236.9723.96Debt to Equity2.083.132.771.160.54The company's revenue increased from Rs 249,794.75 Crore in 2021 to Rs 439,695.00 Crore in 2025. Net profit has also shown a turnaround, from a loss of Rs 13,016.14 Crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 22,991.00 Crore in 2025. Tata Motors Corporate ActionsOn August 21, 2025, a physical group meeting with analysts and institutional investors is scheduled.The financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, were published in the newspaper.The audio call recording of the earnings conference call on the financial results for the first quarter ended June 30, 2025, is available on the company's website.Tata Motors announced a final dividend of Rs 6.00 per share (300%) with an effective date of June 4, 2025. Other dividends include:Rs 3.00 per share (150%) Final Dividend, effective June 11, 2024Rs 3.00 per share (150%) Special Dividend, effective June 11, 2024Rs 2.00 per share (100%) Final Dividend, effective July 28, 2023Tata Motors has a history of bonus issues, including:3:5 bonus ratio, announced on September 28, 1995, ex-bonus date was October 4, 1995.2:5 bonus ratio, announced on April 29, 1982.2:5 bonus ratio, announced on April 29, 1979.Tata Motors has also had rights issues, including:6:109 rights ratio, announced on January 27, 2015, ex-rights date was April 6, 2015.1:6 rights ratio, announced on May 29, 2008, ex-rights date was September 9, 2008.Tata Motors split its shares with the old face value of 10 and new face value of 2 with exsplit date of September 12, 2011. A Moneycontrol analysis on August 13, 2025, indicated a bearish sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading up 3.25%, Tata Motors is one of the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index.

title: Vardhman Textiles, Ambika Cotton Mills & other cotton stocks rally as Centre scraps import duty
content: Shares of cotton-related companies such as Vardhman Textiles, Gokaldas Exports, Ambika Cotton Mills, and Welspun Living rallied in the range of 1 percent to 8 percent on August 19 after the Centre removed the 11 percent import duty on raw cotton till September 30. The Finance Ministry issued a notification through the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC), removing both the basic customs duty and the Agriculture Infrastructure and Development Cess on cotton imports. The decision offers temporary relief to the textile and garment industry, which has been facing challenges amid concerns related to the Trump tariffs. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog This development comes after months of back-and-forth between the two countries. India has stood firm on sensitive sectors such as agriculture and dairy during bilateral trade talks. By easing duty on cotton, New Delhi is signaling some flexibility without giving up its core red lines. The government’s move is aimed at mitigating the pressure of a larger tariff of 50 percent imposed by the US government on Indian exports, the deadline for which is August 27. The exemption is expected to benefit the entire textile chain including yarn, fabric, garments, and made-ups. Meanwhile, the US negotiating team, which was scheduled to visit New Delhi for the sixth round of trade talks on August 25, has cancelled its visit. No fresh date has been announced so far. The move also reflects India’s domestic supply concerns. Cotton availability in the local market has been tight, with industry associations repeatedly warning about the risk of higher yarn prices and downstream cost pressures in textiles. By allowing duty-free imports, the government aims to ease raw material costs ahead of the festival season, a period when demand for garments typically rises. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: The government’s move is aimed at mitigating the pressure of a larger tariff of 50 percent imposed by the US government on Indian exports, the deadline for which is August 27.
summary_luhn: The government’s move is aimed at mitigating the pressure of a larger tariff of 50 percent imposed by the US government on Indian exports, the deadline for which is August 27.
summary_lsa: By easing duty on cotton, New Delhi is signaling some flexibility without giving up its core red lines.

title: ITC shares trade flat in today's session; over 32.9 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of ITC were trading flat in today's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 406.25. According to the data, 3,295,154 shares were traded. As of 10:20 am, the stock showed a marginal decrease of 0.01% from its previous close. The trading volume indicates sustained investor interest in the stock during the session. Moneycontrol analysis as of August 13, 2025, indicates a very bearish sentiment for the stock. Here's a look at the company's recent financial performance. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 21,494.79 Crore, marking an increase compared to Rs 18,457.33 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 5,274.65 Crore, up from Rs 5,169.37 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 4.19, compared to Rs 4.08 in June 2024. The company's annual consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 75,323.34 Crore, which is higher than the Rs 70,881.00 Crore recorded for the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 19,926.05 Crore, while in the year-ending March 2024, the net profit was Rs 20,723.75 Crore. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 27.79, a notable increase from Rs 16.42 in the year-ending March 2024.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to EquityMar 202149,272.7813,389.8010.7049.3121.800.00Mar 202260,668.0915,485.6512.3750.9824.400.00Mar 202370,936.8519,427.6815.5055.9527.750.00Mar 202470,881.0020,723.7516.4259.9927.450.00Mar 202575,323.3419,926.0527.7955.9649.610.00The annual income statement for the year-ending March 2025 shows sales of Rs 75,323 Crore, other income of Rs 2,529 Crore, and total income of Rs 77,853 Crore. The total expenditure was Rs 50,991 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 26,861 Crore. Interest paid was Rs 45 Crore, and tax amounted to Rs 6,890 Crore. The net profit for the year was Rs 19,926 Crore. For the year-ending March 2024, sales stood at Rs 70,881 Crore, other income at Rs 2,727 Crore, and total income at Rs 73,608 Crore. Total expenditure was Rs 46,450 Crore, with an EBIT of Rs 27,158 Crore. Interest paid was Rs 45 Crore, and tax amounted to Rs 6,388 Crore, resulting in a net profit of Rs 20,723 Crore.ParameterMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Sales75,32370,88170,93660,66849,272Other Income2,5292,7271,9801,8362,632Total Income77,85373,60872,91762,50451,905Total Expenditure50,99146,45047,00841,74233,915EBIT26,86127,15825,90920,76217,989Interest4545433944Tax6,8906,3886,4385,2374,555Net Profit19,92620,72319,42715,48513,389ITC announced several corporate actions. On August 12, 2025, there was an announcement under Regulation 30 (LODR) regarding newspaper publication related to the re-lodgement of transfer requests for shares held in physical form. On August 1, 2025, a media statement and investor presentation for Q1 FY 2025-26 was released, along with an announcement regarding the scheme of amalgamation of Sresta Natural Bioproducts Private Limited and Wimco Limited with ITC Limited. The company has declared dividends, including a final dividend of Rs 7.85 per share (785%) effective May 28, 2025, and an interim dividend of Rs 6.50 per share (650%) effective February 12, 2025. The company has also issued bonus shares in the past, with the most recent bonus issue on July 1, 2016, in the ratio of 1:2. ITC had a stock split on September 21, 2005, where the old face value of Rs 10 was split into a new face value of Rs 1. With the stock's current trading price at Rs 406.25, ITC saw over 32.9 lakh shares traded.

The company announced a final dividend of Rs 3.00 per share (30%) on May 19, 2025, with an effective date of July 4, 2025. title: Larsen & Toubro shares trade flat in today's session; over 1.5 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading flat in today's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 3,638.50, a marginal gain of 0.09% on the NSE. During the trading session, over 1.5 lakh shares were traded. Trading Volume & Market Impact The traded volume of Larsen & Toubro shares stood at 156,207. This trading activity suggested a marginal decrease in investor interest as the stock showed a slight gain. Recent Financial Performance The financial performance of Larsen & Toubro reveals the following key figures: Consolidated Quarterly Results: For the quarter-ending June 2025:Revenue: Rs 63,678.92 CroreNet Profit: Rs 4,325.57 CroreEPS: Rs 26.30The company's revenue increased from Rs 55,119.82 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 63,678.92 Crore in June 2025. Net profit also increased from Rs 3,440.11 Crore to Rs 4,325.57 Crore during the same period. Additionally, the EPS rose from Rs 20.26 to Rs 26.30. title: Ola Electric stock jumps 7.9%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: At 10:30 am on Tuesday, Ola Electric was identified as one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. According to the data, Ola Electric shares gained 7.88%, with the price reaching Rs 44.49.Financial PerformanceA review of Ola Electric's financial performance reveals the following:Consolidated Quarterly ResultsThe consolidated quarterly results show a fluctuating revenue trend. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 828.00 Crore, a decrease compared to Rs 1,644.00 Crore in June 2024. Net profit also showed a similar trend, with a loss of Rs -428.00 Crore in June 2025 compared to a loss of Rs -347.00 Crore in June 2024. The EPS for June 2025 was Rs -0.97, slightly up from Rs -0.95 in June 2024.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,644.00 CroreRs 1,214.00 CroreRs 1,045.00 CroreRs 611.00 CroreRs 828.00 CroreNet Profit-Rs 347.00 Crore-Rs 495.00 Crore-Rs 564.00 Crore-Rs 870.00 Crore-Rs 428.00 CroreEPS-0.95-1.20-1.28-1.97-0.97Consolidated Yearly ResultsThe consolidated yearly results indicate a decrease in revenue from Rs 5,009.83 Crore in 2024 to Rs 4,514.00 Crore in 2025. The net profit also declined, with a loss of Rs -2,276.00 Crore in 2025 compared to a loss of Rs -1,584.40 Crore in 2024. The EPS decreased from Rs -4.35 in 2024 to Rs -5.48 in 2025. The book value per share (BVPS) increased to Rs 11.66 in 2025 from Rs -4.88 in 2024. The return on equity (ROE) was -44.25% in 2025. title: Bharat Dynamics stock falls 2.73%, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: In today's session, Bharat Dynamics' stock experienced a decline, trading at Rs 1,561.70, a 2.73% fall. The stock is currently among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. Bharat Dynamics Ltd has scheduled a board meeting on August 12, 2025, to consider and approve the unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. Financial Snapshot: Reviewing the financial performance of Bharat Dynamics, here's a summary of key figures from the standalone income statement:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 3,345 CroreRs 2,369 CroreRs 2,489 CroreRs 2,817 CroreRs 1,913 CroreOther IncomeRs 350 CroreRs 361 CroreRs 155 CroreRs 111 CroreRs 94 CroreTotal IncomeRs 3,695 CroreRs 2,731 CroreRs 2,644 CroreRs 2,928 CroreRs 2,008 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 2,943 CroreRs 1,899 CroreRs 2,158 CroreRs 2,215 CroreRs 1,663 CroreEBITRs 752 CroreRs 831 CroreRs 486 CroreRs 713 CroreRs 344 CroreInterestRs 3 CroreRs 3 CroreRs 4 CroreRs 3 CroreRs 3 CroreTaxRs 199 CroreRs 215 CroreRs 129 CroreRs 209 CroreRs 83 CroreNet ProfitRs 549 CroreRs 612 CroreRs 352 CroreRs 499 CroreRs 257 CroreThe sales for March 2025 stood at Rs 3,345 Crore compared to Rs 2,369 Crore in March 2024. Other income for the same period was Rs 350 Crore and Rs 361 Crore respectively. The total expenditure was Rs 2,943 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 1,899 Crore in March 2024. Net profit for March 2025 was Rs 549 Crore, while in March 2024, it was Rs 612 Crore. The quarterly income statement indicates sales of Rs 247 Crore for June 2025, compared to Rs 1,776 Crore for March 2025. The net profit for June 2025 was Rs 18 Crore, while it was Rs 272 Crore for March 2025. The company’s cash flow from operating activities was Rs 167 Crore for March 2025, compared to Rs 411 Crore for March 2024. The net cash flow was Rs -459 Crore for both March 2025 and March 2024. The balance sheet shows total liabilities of Rs 11,742 Crore and total assets of Rs 11,742 Crore for March 2025. Financial Ratios: Key financial ratios for Bharat Dynamics indicate a basic EPS of Rs 14.99 and diluted EPS of Rs 14.99 for March 2025. The book value per share was Rs 109.37, and the dividend per share was Rs 4.65. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions: Bharat Dynamics announced an interim dividend of Rs 4.00 per share (80%) with an effective date of February 14, 2025. Additionally, a stock split was announced on March 21, 2024, with an ex-split date of May 24, 2024, changing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 5. As of August 12, 2025, Moneycontrol analysis indicates a bearish sentiment on Bharat Dynamics.

title: Fitch says second-order effects of US tariffs rising for India Inc, but a trade deal can reduce risks
content: Rating agency Fitch has said in a note that India Inc has 'generally' low direct exposure to US tariffs, however, sectors that are currently unaffected, such as Pharma, could be hit by further US tariff announcements, while adding that second-order effects too are on the rise. The note, however, added that a trade deal between US and India could reduce these risks, even as India stares at an additional 25 percent levy over its oil imports from Russia, effective from August 27. For Indian pharma companies, US is a key export market, and tariff risk on these items is not yet fully factored in, said Fitch, and could pose downside risks to these businesses. The note cited Biocon's example, which derives around 40 percent of its sales from US through products mostly manufactured in India and Malaysia. "The competitive industry landscape could limit Biocon’s ability to pass on higher costs, despite the non-discretionary demand for its products," Fitch said. For crop production chemical producer UPL, US buyers make up for 10-12 percent of total revenue, and any tariff on its products could potentially affect its competitiveness in the American market. However, UPL still has 'significant' geographical and product diversification, Fitch added, which could mean the company will still be able to meet EBITDA growth guidance of 10-14 percent in constant currency terms, though the risk remains. "...we see limited risk to our EBITDA growth estimate of 11 percent (in US dollar terms) and leverage forecast for the financial year ending March 2026," Fitch added. While India's direct exports of automotives to the US are limited, America still accounts for close to 20 percent of sales for auto supplier Samvardhana Motherson (SAMIL). These are supplied mostly from US production bases or from Mexico, which has secured a tariff exemption under an agreement. Still, Fitch had revised its Outlook on SAMIL to Stable from Positive in May 2025. Fitch said it expects a weak global auto sector outlook owing to tariff-related uncertainty. Fitch has assumed a very minimal direct tariff impact on Indian IT services, along with those companies that are domestically focused. Oil and gas, cement, engineering and construction, telecom and utilities are at lower risk of a direct impact. Though if US tariffs stay significantly higher than Asian peers, Fitch said it sees a moderate downside risk to India's growth forecast for FY26, which would weigh on the operating performance of India Inc. "India’s corporates could also be affected if US tariffs divert supply to other markets, including India, as this could present downside risks to our domestic price assumptions for some products, such as steel and chemicals," the note added. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Tube Investments of India shares rise 2.06%; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Tube Investments of India Ltd were trading at Rs 3,114.00, up by 2.06% in Tuesday's session at 10:14 am. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 5,309.06 Crore, compared to Rs 4,577.92 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 303.28 Crore, while in June 2024, it was Rs 313.80 Crore. The EPS for June 2025 was Rs 10.28, down from Rs 11.64 in June 2024. The company's consolidated annual revenue has shown consistent growth. In 2025, the revenue was Rs 19,464.65 Crore, a significant increase compared to Rs 6,083.29 Crore in 2021. Similarly, the net profit for 2025 was Rs 1,054.67 Crore, compared to Rs 304.69 Crore in 2021. title: Sona BLW Precision Forgings shares rise 2.71%; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Sona BLW Precision Forgings were trading at Rs 457, up by 2.71 percent at 10:09 am on Tuesday. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The consolidated revenue for Sona BLW Precision Forgings for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 850.90 Crore, compared to Rs 893.03 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 121.71 Crore, down from Rs 141.71 Crore in the previous year. Sona BLW Precision Forgings' consolidated yearly revenue has shown growth, with the revenue in 2025 at Rs 3,546.02 Crore, compared to Rs 3,184.77 Crore in 2024. The net profit also increased from Rs 517.78 Crore in 2024 to Rs 599.69 Crore in 2025. title: Infosys shares among top gainers on Nifty 50; stock rises 0.45%
content: Shares of Infosys were trading higher at Rs 1,442.30, a gain of 0.45% in Tuesday's session. The stock was identified among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index during this hour. On the financial front, Infosys has demonstrated consistent growth. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 42,279 Crore, up from Rs 39,315 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 6,924 Crore, compared to Rs 6,374 Crore in the corresponding period last year. The EPS (Earnings Per Share) increased to Rs 16.70 in June 2025 from Rs 15.38 in June 2024. The company's annual performance also reflects a strong upward trajectory. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 162,990 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 153,670 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 26,750 Crore, compared to Rs 26,248 Crore in March 2024. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 64.50, up from Rs 63.39 in the previous year. Here is a summary of Infosys's financial performance:Financials (Consolidated)Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 39,315.00 CroreRs 40,986.00 CroreRs 41,764.00 CroreRs 40,925.00 CroreRs 42,279.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 6,374.00 CroreRs 6,516.00 CroreRs 6,822.00 CroreRs 7,038.00 CroreRs 6,924.00 CroreEPS15.3815.7116.4316.9816.70Annual Consolidated Financials:Financials (Consolidated)20212022202320242025RevenueRs 100,472.00 CroreRs 121,641.00 CroreRs 146,767.00 CroreRs 153,670.00 CroreRs 162,990.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 19,423.00 CroreRs 22,146.00 CroreRs 24,108.00 CroreRs 26,248.00 CroreRs 26,750.00 CroreEPS45.6152.5257.6363.3964.50BVPS180.75180.50183.17212.74231.11ROE25.3429.3431.9529.7727.87Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00Infosys announced a final dividend of Rs 22 per share (440%) on April 17, 2025, with an effective date of May 30, 2025. Additionally, a bonus issue of 1:1 was announced on July 13, 2018, with an ex-bonus date of September 4, 2018. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bearish sentiment on the stock as of today. Infosys is among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 this hour.

title: Kalyan Jewellers India shares fall 2.85%, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Kalyan Jewellers India experienced a decline of 2.85% to Rs 505.35 in Tuesday's trading session, with the stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150. The stock's movement reflects a very bearish sentiment, according to a recent Moneycontrol analysis. Recent Financial Performance: Let's delve into the financial performance of Kalyan Jewellers India based on available data. The data includes both quarterly and yearly consolidated results. Consolidated Quarterly Results: Here’s a look at the consolidated quarterly results for key financial metrics:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 5,535.48 CroreRs 6,065.48 CroreRs 7,286.88 CroreRs 6,181.53 CroreRs 7,268.48 CroreNet ProfitRs 177.56 CroreRs 130.33 CroreRs 218.68 CroreRs 187.61 CroreRs 264.08 CroreEPS1.731.272.121.822.56The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 7,268.48 Crore, showcasing a notable increase compared to the Rs 5,535.48 Crore recorded in June 2024. Similarly, the net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 264.08 Crore, up from Rs 177.56 Crore in June 2024. title: Bharti Airtel shares up 1.73%, among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading higher in Tuesday's session, with the stock priced at Rs 1,925. This represents a gain of 1.73% from the previous close. The stock was identified among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index during this hour. Financial Performance: Bharti Airtel has demonstrated significant financial growth over the past few years. The company's board has also engaged in earnings calls to discuss financial results. Dividends: Bharti Airtel has consistently distributed dividends to its shareholders. The most recent dividend announcement was on May 13, 2025, for a final dividend of Rs 16.00 per share (320%), effective July 18, 2025. The company also announced Final dividend of Rs.8.0000 per share(160%)Dividend on May 14, 2024 with effective date of August 07, 2024. Prior to this, a dividend of Rs 4.00 per share was announced on May 16, 2023, and another of Rs 3.00 per share was announced on May 17, 2022. Rights Issues: Bharti Airtel has also undertaken rights issues. A rights issue was announced on August 29, 2021, with an existing ratio of 14 and an offered ratio of 1, a face value of Rs 5 and a premium of Rs 530. The record date was September 28, 2021, and the ex-rights date was September 27, 2021. Another rights issue was announced on February 28, 2019. Stock Splits: The company executed a stock split on July 24, 2009, where the old face value of Rs 10 was split into a new face value of Rs 5. In summary, Bharti Airtel's stock is currently trading higher, reflecting its strong financial performance and consistent corporate actions. title: Tata Motors shares rise 2.35% in morning trade, among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Tata Motors gained 2.35% to trade at Rs 691.90 in Tuesday's session. The stock is performing positively today, and is among the top gainers on the benchmark Nifty 50 index. Financial Performance: Tata Motors has demonstrated the following financial performance (Consolidated): Quarterly Results:Revenue: The company’s revenue has shown fluctuations over the last five quarters. It started at Rs 108,048.00 Crore in June 2024, dipped to Rs 101,450.00 Crore in September 2024, then increased to Rs 113,575.00 Crore in December 2024 and Rs 119,503.00 Crore in March 2025, before settling at Rs 104,407.00 Crore in June 2025.Net Profit: The net profit followed a similar trend, starting at Rs 5,563.00 Crore in June 2024, decreasing to Rs 3,368.00 Crore in September 2024, rising to Rs 5,616.00 Crore in December 2024 and Rs 8,442.00 Crore in March 2025, and then decreasing to Rs 3,871.00 Crore in June 2025.EPS: The Earnings Per Share (EPS) values were 14.61 in June 2024, 9.72 in September 2024, 14.81 in December 2024, 23.40 in March 2025, and 10.66 in June 2025.Annual Results:Revenue: The company's revenue increased steadily from Rs 249,794.75 Crore in 2021 to Rs 437,927.77 Crore in 2024, and then slightly increased to Rs 439,695.00 Crore in 2025.Net Profit: Tata Motors moved from a net loss of Rs -13,016.14 Crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 31,106.95 Crore in 2024, before decreasing to Rs 22,991.00 Crore in 2025.EPS: The Earnings Per Share (EPS) improved significantly from Rs -36.99 in 2021 to Rs 81.95 in 2024, before decreasing to Rs 78.80 in 2025.BVPS: The Book Value Per Share (BVPS) has shown a consistent increase from Rs 148.39 in 2021 to Rs 315.61 in 2025.ROE: The Return on Equity (ROE) has improved from -24.34% in 2021 to 36.97% in 2024, before decreasing to 23.96% in 2025.Debt to Equity: The Debt to Equity ratio has decreased from 2.08 in 2021 to 0.54 in 2025.The following table summarizes the consolidated annual income statement of Tata 2025 compared to 2024. Tata Motors announced the following corporate actions:On August 21, 2025, a physical group meeting is scheduled with Analysts / Institutional Investor(s).The Financial Results of Tata Motors Limited for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, were published in the newspaper.The audio call recording of the earnings conference call on the Financial Results for the first quarter ended June 30, 2025, is available on the Company's website.The company announced a final dividend of Rs 6 per share (300%) on May 13, 2025, with an effective date of June 4, 2025. Tata Motors had a bonus issue on September 28, 1995, with an ex-bonus date of October 4, 1995, in the ratio of 3:5. Tata Motors had a stock split on May 26, 2011, with an ex-split date of September 12, 2011, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 2. Moneycontrol analysis on August 13, 2025, indicated a bearish sentiment for Tata Motors. With the stock currently trading at Rs 691.90, Tata Motors demonstrates a positive move in today's session.

title: Inox Wind shares gain 6% on Rs 175 crore stake sale in EPC subsidiary
content: Shares of Inox Wind rose as much as 6 percent to Rs 147.80 in morning deals on Tuesday after the company said it had divested a stake worth about Rs 175 crore in its subsidiary Inox Renewable Solutions Ltd. (IRSL). The company disclosed in a regulatory filing that it has signed agreements, last executed on August 18, to sell 49.6 lakh equity shares of IRSL, each with a face value of Rs 10. The transaction values the subsidiary at around Rs 7,400 crore, with the sale expected to be completed within the next seven days. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates IRSL, formerly known as Resco Global Wind Services, reported revenue of Rs 217.98 crore in FY25, contributing about 6 percent to Inox Wind’s consolidated revenue. Its net worth stood at Rs 935 crore, accounting for 14 percent of the parent’s consolidated net worth. Inox Wind’s consolidated profit after tax surged to Rs 105.8 crore in the June quarter, up from Rs 10.3 crore a year earlier, aided by higher other income and lower finance costs. Other income rose to Rs 36.3 crore from Rs 15.1 crore, while finance costs declined to Rs 33.8 crore from Rs 55.8 crore in the same period last year. Revenue for the quarter increased 29.2 percent to Rs 826.3 crore compared with Rs 639.6 crore in the year-ago period. The company’s EBITDA margin expanded to 22.2 percent from 21.1 percent a year earlier. Inox Wind also took a deferred tax charge of Rs 40 crore, with reversal of deferred tax assets already recognised in earlier years. Following Q1, Nuvama Institutional Equities cut its price target on the stock by 19 percent to Rs 190 from Rs 236. The brokerage, however, maintained its “buy” rating, noting that the revised target still implies an upside of around 39 percent from current levels. Nuvama highlighted that Inox Wind reported modest execution in the June quarter at 146 megawatts (MW) versus consensus estimates of 180 MW. Order intake during the quarter was soft at 51 MW, taking the order book to 3.1 GW with an execution horizon of more than 24 months. The brokerage has trimmed its FY26 and FY27 execution estimates to 1.1 GW and 1.8 GW, down from earlier projections of 1.2 GW and 2 GW, respectively. At about 10:10 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 146, higher by 5.6 percent from the last close on the NSE. Inox Wind shares are down 18.5 percent since the beginning of the year. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: Inox Wind’s consolidated profit after tax surged to Rs 105.8 crore in the June quarter, up from Rs 10.3 crore a year earlier, aided by higher other income and lower finance costs.

summary_lsa: Shares of Inox Wind rose as much as 6 percent to Rs 147.80 in morning deals on Tuesday after the company said it had divested a stake worth about Rs 175 crore in its subsidiary Inox Renewable Solutions Ltd. (IRSL).
summary_textrank: Other income rose to Rs 36.3 crore from Rs 15.1 crore, while finance costs declined to Rs 33.8 crore from Rs 55.8 crore in the same period last year.

title: Maruti Suzuki India shares rise, hit 52-week high in early trade
content: Shares of Maruti Suzuki India reached a 52-week high of Rs 14,139.00 on the NSE in early trade. At 09:54 am, the stock was trading at Rs 14,123.00, a 0.39% increase from its previous close. Financial Performance: Maruti Suzuki India has demonstrated strong financial performance over the past few years. Here’s a look at the company’s consolidated financial data: Consolidated Yearly Performance:HeadingMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 70,372.00 CroreRs 88,329.80 CroreRs 117,571.30 CroreRs 141,858.20 CroreRs 152,913.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 4,220.10 CroreRs 3,717.60 CroreRs 8,033.60 CroreRs 13,234.10 CroreRs 14,256.30 CroreEPSRs 145.30Rs 128.43Rs 271.82Rs 429.01Rs 461.20BVPSRs 1,738.43Rs 1,832.24Rs 2,046.07Rs 2,723.79Rs 3,061.07ROE8.367.0113.2815.7515.06Debt to Equity0.010.010.020.000.00The company's revenue has consistently increased, with revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reaching Rs 152,913.00 Crore compared to Rs 70,372.00 Crore in March 2021. Net profit also saw a significant rise, from Rs 4,220.10 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 14,256.30 Crore in March 2025. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased from Rs 145.30 in 2021 to Rs 461.20 in 2025. Consolidated Quarterly Performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 35,779.40 CroreRs 37,449.20 CroreRs 38,764.30 CroreRs 40,920.10 CroreRs 38,605.20 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,702.10 CroreRs 3,055.20 CroreRs 3,659.80 CroreRs 3,839.20 CroreRs 3,756.90 CroreEPSRs 119.58Rs 98.68Rs 118.54Rs 124.40Rs 120.62The quarterly revenue showed consistent growth, increasing from Rs 35,779.40 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 40,920.10 Crore in March 2025 before slightly decreasing to Rs 38,605.20 Crore in June 2025. Net profit also remained strong, with Rs 3,756.90 Crore reported for the quarter-ending June 2025. Corporate Actions: The company announced a final dividend of Rs 135.00 per share (2700%) on April 25, 2025, with an effective date of August 1, 2025. Earlier dividends include Rs 125.00 per share in 2024, Rs 90.00 per share in 2023, Rs 60.00 per share in 2022 and Rs 45.00 per share in 2021. title: Waaree Energies shares rise 2.12%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150 in early trade
content: shares of Waaree Energies gained 2.12% to trade at Rs 3,048.10 in early trade. The stock is among the top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150 as of 9:26 am. Financial Highlights: Consolidated Financial Performance: Waaree Energies has demonstrated substantial growth in its consolidated financial performance over the past few years. Revenue: The company's revenue has seen significant growth. The annual revenue increased from Rs 2,854.27 Crore in 2022 to Rs 14,444.50 Crore in 2025. Net Profit: The net profit has also shown a remarkable increase, rising from Rs 79.65 Crore in 2022 to Rs 1,928.13 Crore in 2025. EPS: The earnings per share (EPS) have grown from Rs 3.84 in 2022 to Rs 68.24 in 2025. BVPS: The book value per share has increased from Rs 21.69 to Rs 329.96 during the same period. ROE: The return on equity (ROE) was 19.69% for the year 2025. Debt to Equity: The debt-to-equity ratio stood at 0.10 as of 2025. Quarterly Performance: The company's quarterly revenue has increased steadily, with revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 at Rs 4,425.83 Crore, up from Rs 3,408.90 Crore in June 2024. Similarly, the net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 772.89 Crore, compared to Rs 401.13 Crore in June 2024. Standalone Income Statement (Annual): Waaree Energies' standalone financials also reflect robust growth. Sales increased from Rs 2,771 Crore in 2022 to Rs 12,764 Crore in 2025. The net profit rose from Rs 69 Crore in 2022 to Rs 1,781 Crore in 2025. Standalone Income Statement (Quarterly): The quarterly sales have shown consistent performance, with sales at Rs 3,369 Crore for June 2025. The net profit for the same period was Rs 659 Crore. Cash Flow: The cash flow from operating activities for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 2,939 Crore. The net cash flow was Rs 249 Crore for the same period. Balance Sheet: The company's total assets have grown from Rs 2,039 Crore in 2022 to Rs 17,851 Crore in 2025. The share capital increased from Rs 197 Crore to Rs 287 Crore during the same period. Financial Ratios: Key financial ratios for Waaree Energies show a basic EPS of Rs 65.09 and a diluted EPS of Rs 64.82 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.10 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions: Waaree Energies has made several announcements including Monitoring Agency Report on the utilisation of the proceeds raised through issuance of Equity Shares by way of Public Issue for the Quarter ended June 30, 2025. Waaree Energies has demonstrated substantial growth in its consolidated financial performance over the past few years.
summary_lexrank: The annual revenue increased from Rs 2,854.27 Crore in 2022 to Rs 14,444.50 Crore in 2025.
summary_luhn: Quarterly Performance: The company's quarterly revenue has increased steadily, with revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 at Rs 4,425.83 Crore, up from Rs 3,408.90 Crore in June 2024.
