title: Hero Motocorp shares rise 2.15% in early trade
content: Shares of Hero Motocorp gained 2.15% to trade at Rs 5,091.00 in Tuesday's session. The stock showed positive movement in today's session. On the financial front, Hero Motocorp's consolidated yearly revenue has shown consistent growth. The annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 40,923.42 Crore, compared to Rs 37,788.62 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the same period was Rs 4,536.93 Crore, up from Rs 3,862.41 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The company's Earnings Per Share (EPS) also increased, with the EPS for the year-ending March 2025 at Rs 218.96, compared to Rs 187.36 for the year-ending March 2024. Book Value Per Share (BVPS) increased from Rs 892.17 in March 2024 to Rs 963.60 in March 2025. The Return on Equity (ROE) also saw an increase, reaching 22.71% in March 2025 from 21.15% in March 2024. The Debt to Equity ratio remained stable at 0.02. The consolidated quarterly revenue for June 2025 stood at Rs 9,727.75 Crore, compared to Rs 10,210.79 Crore for June 2024. The net profit for the quarter was Rs 1,076.21 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 1,086.35 Crore reported in June 2024. The EPS for June 2025 was Rs 85.26, compared to Rs 52.31 in June 2024.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to EquityMar 202130,959.192,982.61146.07778.7618.920.02Mar 202229,551.282,528.10115.96800.5414.620.02Mar 202334,158.382,796.79140.62839.6616.870.02Mar 202437,788.623,862.41187.36892.1721.150.02Mar 202540,923.424,536.93218.96963.6022.710.02The revenue increased by 8.29 percent in 2025 compared to 2024. The net profit increased by 17.47 percent in 2025 compared to 2024.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 202410,210.791,086.3552.31Sep 202410,482.931,152.7553.19Dec 202410,259.891,200.1255.38Mar 20259,969.811,097.7158.08Jun 20259,727.751,076.2185.26The company announced a change in senior management personnel on August 19, 2025. Additionally, the transcript of the earnings conference call for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, was attached on August 12, 2025. The audio recording of the earnings call for the quarter ended on June 30, 2025, is available on the company's website. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 65 per share (3250%) on May 13, 2025, with an effective date of July 24, 2025. An interim dividend of Rs 100 per share (5000%) was announced on February 6, 2025, effective February 12, 2025. Hero Motocorp had a stock split on March 12, 2001, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 2. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment for Hero Motocorp as of today. With the stock currently trading at Rs 5,091.00, Hero Motocorp has shown a positive movement in Tuesday's early trading session.
summary_lexrank: The consolidated quarterly revenue for June 2025 stood at Rs 9,727.75 Crore, compared to Rs 10,210.79 Crore for June 2024.
summary_lsa: Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment for Hero Motocorp as of today.

title: Bharti Airtel shares rise 1.86% in early trade
content: Bharti Airtel shares are trading higher in Tuesday's session. The stock is currently priced at Rs 1,927.50, a gain of 1.86% from the previous close, as of 9:30 am. Financial Performance: Bharti Airtel's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the past few years. The company's revenue has increased steadily on both a quarterly and annual basis. The net profit has also seen a significant rise in the most recent year. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 49,462.60 Crore, up from Rs 47,876.20 Crore in March 2025, Rs 45,129.30 Crore in December 2024, Rs 41,473.30 Crore in September 2024, and Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 7,339.00 Crore, compared to Rs 12,418.10 Crore in March 2025, Rs 14,474.90 Crore in December 2024, Rs 3,079.50 Crore in September 2024, and Rs 3,805.80 Crore in June 2024. The annual consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 172,985.20 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 149,982.40 Crore in March 2024, Rs 139,144.80 Crore in March 2023, Rs 116,546.90 Crore in March 2022, and Rs 100,615.80 Crore in March 2021. The net profit for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 33,778.30 Crore, a significant improvement compared to Rs 5,848.60 Crore in March 2024, Rs 11,535.30 Crore in March 2023, Rs 5,882.00 Crore in March 2022, and a loss of Rs -23,327.90 Crore in March 2021. The company has announced dividends previously. An interim dividend of Rs 7.00 per share (700%) was announced on June 13, 2025, with an effective date of June 24, 2025. Prior to that, an interim dividend of Rs 8.50 per share (850%) was announced on December 11, 2024, and another dividend of Rs 20.00 per share (2000%) was announced on August 28, 2024. Vedanta has also issued bonus shares in the past, with the most recent bonus issue on April 28, 2008, in the ratio of 1:1. Additionally, the company had a stock split on August 8, 2008, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 1. With the stock currently trading at Rs 447.70, Vedanta shows a positive uptrend in today's early trading session on Nifty Next 50.

title: Tata Consultancy Services shares gain marginally in early trade
content: Shares of Tata Consultancy Services were trading at Rs 3,016.50 on the NSE at 09:30 am, a marginal increase of 0.18% from the previous close. Financial Snapshot: The following table presents a summary of Tata Consultancy Services' consolidated quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 62,613.00 CroreRs 64,259.00 CroreRs 63,973.00 CroreRs 64,479.00 CroreRs 63,437.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 12,105.00 CroreRs 11,955.00 CroreRs 12,444.00 CroreRs 12,293.00 CroreRs 12,819.00 CroreEPS33.2832.9234.2133.7935.27The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,437.00 Crore, slightly increased compared to Rs 62,613.00 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 12,819.00 Crore, compared to Rs 12,105.00 Crore in June 2024. The EPS increased from 33.28 in June 2024 to 35.27 in June 2025. Similarly, the net profit has risen from Rs 32,562.00 Crore in 2021 to Rs 48,797.00 Crore in 2025. The EPS has also grown steadily, from 86.71 in 2021 to 134.19 in 2025. The company has maintained a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 across these years. title: Bharat Dynamics shares fall 2.15%; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150

The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index, reflecting a notable decrease from its previous close. title: Ashok Leyland shares fall 2.81%; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: At 9:30 am on Tuesday, Ashok Leyland shares were trading at Rs 128.06 on the NSE, a 2.81% decline from the previous close. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index in today's session. New India Assurance and Max Financial also featured among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150, with declines of 1.35% and 1.32% respectively. Financial Snapshot: The following table presents a summary of Ashok Leyland's key financial figures.HeadingYearValue (Rs Crore)Revenue202119,454.10202226,237.15202341,672.60202445,790.64202548,535.14Net Profit2021-69.102022-292.9720231,350.9120242,679.9620253,351.21EPS2021-0.562022-1.2220234.2320248.46202510.58The consolidated annual revenue for Ashok Leyland has shown consistent growth, increasing from Rs 19,454.10 Crore in 2021 to Rs 48,535.14 Crore in 2025. Net profit has also seen a significant turnaround, from a loss of Rs 69.10 Crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 3,351.21 Crore in 2025. Similarly, the consolidated EPS has improved from -0.56 in 2021 to Rs 10.58 in 2025. Quarterly Performance:HeadingQuarterValue (Rs Crore)RevenueJun 202410,724.49Sep 202411,147.58Dec 202411,995.21Mar 202514,695.55Jun 202511,708.54Net ProfitJun 2024549.53Sep 2024755.21Dec 2024812.09Mar 20251,234.38Jun 2025652.98EPSJun 20241.73Sep 20242.40Dec 20242.59Mar 20253.85Jun 20251.04Ashok Leyland's quarterly revenue shows a fluctuating pattern. The revenue increased from Rs 10,724.49 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 14,695.55 Crore in March 2025, then slightly decreased to Rs 11,708.54 Crore in June 2025. Net profit also fluctuated, reaching a peak of Rs 1,234.38 Crore in March 2025. EPS followed a similar trend, peaking at Rs 3.85 in March 2025. All the values are consolidated. Corporate Actions Ashok Leyland announced a bonus issue on May 23, 2025, with a ratio of 1:1 and a record date of July 16, 2025. The ex-bonus date is also July 16, 2025. Additionally, the company announced an interim dividend of Rs 4.25 per share (425%) on May 13, 2025, effective from May 22, 2025. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 128.06, Ashok Leyland is currently among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index.

title: Top Midcap Gainers: Ola Electric shares jump 6%; MRF, Petronet LNG, other stocks lead on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Indian stock markets witnessed gains in several shares during Tuesday's session. Leading the pack on the Nifty Midcap 150 were Ola Electric, MRF, Petronet LNG, JSW Infra, and Tube Investment stocks. At 9:30 am, Ola Electric shares surged by 5.8%, making it the top gainer. MRF followed, with a 1.35% increase to Rs 146,465.00. Petronet LNG saw a rise of 1.3%, reaching Rs 277.30, while JSW Infra increased by 1.21% to Rs 312.85. Tube Investment rounded out the top gainers with a 1.14% increase, trading at Rs 3,085.90. Ola Electric Financials The company's consolidated quarterly financials reveal the following trends:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,644.00 CroreRs 1,214.00 CroreRs 1,045.00 CroreRs 611.00 CroreRs 828.00 CroreNet Profit-Rs 347.00 Crore-Rs 495.00 Crore-Rs 564.00 Crore-Rs 870.00 Crore-Rs 428.00 CroreEPS-0.95-1.20-1.28-1.97-0.97Ola Electric's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 828.00 Crore, compared to Rs 611.00 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The company's net loss for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 428.00 Crore. Ola Electric Mobility Limited has been actively communicating with shareholders, providing general updates and press releases as announced on August 16, 2025. These communications comply with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015. MRF Financials The company's consolidated quarterly financials reveal the following trends:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 7,196.45 CroreRs 6,881.09 CroreRs 7,000.82 CroreRs 7,074.82 CroreRs 7,675.69 CroreNet ProfitRs 571.02 CroreRs 470.70 CroreRs 315.46 CroreRs 512.11 CroreRs 500.47 CroreEPS1,346.381,109.85743.801,207.481,180.04MRF's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 7,675.69 Crore, up from Rs 7,074.82 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 500.47 Crore. MRF announced a final dividend of Rs 229 per share on May 7, 2025, with an effective date of July 18, 2025. The company had also announced previous interim dividends on January 30, 2025 (Rs 3 per share) and October 23, 2024 (Rs 3 per share). Petronet LNG Financials The company's consolidated quarterly financials show the following:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 13,415.13 CroreRs 13,024.29 CroreRs 12,226.86 CroreRs 12,315.75 CroreRs 11,879.86 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,100.76 CroreRs 848.99 CroreRs 866.59 CroreRs 1,067.58 CroreRs 824.44 CroreEPS7.375.806.017.305.61Petronet LNG's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 11,879.86 Crore, a slight decrease from Rs 12,315.75 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 824.44 Crore. Petronet LNG announced a final dividend of Rs 3 per share on May 19, 2025, with an effective date of July 4, 2025. The company had also announced an interim dividend of Rs 7 per share on October 24, 2024. JSW Infra Financials The company's consolidated quarterly financials are as follows:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,009.77 CroreRs 1,001.36 CroreRs 1,181.83 CroreRs 1,283.18 CroreRs 1,223.85 CroreNet ProfitRs 296.55 CroreRs 373.73 CroreRs 335.62 CroreRs 515.58 CroreRs 389.57 CroreEPS1.421.801.592.461.85JSW Infra's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 reached Rs 1,223.85 Crore, up from Rs 1,283.18 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025. The company's net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 389.57 Crore. JSW Infra announced a final dividend of Rs 0.80 per share on April 30, 2025, with an effective date of July 1, 2025. Tube Investment Financials The company's consolidated quarterly financials show the following trends:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 4,577.92 CroreRs 4,924.55 CroreRs 4,812.22 CroreRs 5,149.96 CroreRs 5,309.06 CroreNet ProfitRs 313.80 CroreRs 299.30 CroreRs 280.22 CroreRs 158.22 CroreRs 303.28 CroreEPS11.6410.6910.012.4110.28Tube Investment's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 5,309.06 Crore, compared to Rs 5,149.96 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The company had also announced an interim dividend of Rs 2 per share on February 3, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis on August 14, 2025, indicated bearish sentiment for these stocks.

title: Commercial vehicle outlook set to improve if GST, credit measures come through: Ashok Leyland
content: India’s commercial vehicle industry could be on the cusp of a turnaround if two policy measures fall into place — a reduction in Goods and Services Tax (GST) and easier access to credit. For Shenu Agarwal, managing director and chief executive of Ashok Leyland, these changes would not just lift sentiment but also trigger a sharp revival in demand, reshaping the growth path for FY26 and FY27. At present, commercial vehicles are taxed at 28 percent, among the highest rates in the GST structure. A cut to 18 percent, Agarwal told CNBC TV-18, would be a landmark shift. Lowering the tax burden would immediately reduce acquisition costs, encourage consumption, and ultimately generate more freight for the vehicles to carry. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates The other critical piece, he added, lies in financing. With more than 90 percent of CV purchases funded by loans, industry participants are watching for Reserve Bank of India measures that could ease credit flow to the sector. A combination of these two steps, Agarwal believes, would provide an instant boost to demand by addressing the twin hurdles of high upfront costs and tight financing. Ashok Leyland’s own performance in the June quarter reflected resilience in a testing environment. The company expanded its market share across key categories, gaining 1.3 percent in the medium and heavy commercial vehicle segment, led by a 1.8 percent rise in trucks. The bus business, however, ceded ground as demand shifted towards fully built vehicles. In the light commercial vehicle category, too, Ashok Leyland added 1.2 percent market share. Exports jumped 29 percent year-on-year, but despite the strong start, Agarwal has kept the FY26 growth target unchanged at 20–25 percent, pointing out that the company’s key overseas markets have remained insulated from global disruptions. Looking to the second quarter, Agarwal expects support from a low base to lift performance. On the electric mobility front, he said operations at Switch India have been stabilised, putting the unit on course to turn PAT positive by the end of FY26 — a milestone in the group’s EV journey. Also read: Unlisted shares slide sharply from June peak on IPO jitters The defence business, meanwhile, saw a year-on-year decline in the first quarter due to the execution of a large order in the same period last year, but the order book remains strong at around Rs 1,000 crore. Agarwal expects the vertical to deliver 25–30 percent topline growth this fiscal, backed by both fresh and repeat demand. Following Q1, UBS reiterated a “buy” call on the stock with a target price of Rs 150, highlighting that the company delivered a margin beat on the back of operational discipline. The brokerage noted that medium and heavy commercial vehicle (MHCV) growth is expected in mid-single digits, while light commercial vehicle (LCV) growth could be slightly better. At about 9:25 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 128, lower by 3 percent as investors booked profit after a massive 7 percent rally in the previous session. Ashok Leyland shares are up 16 percent since the beginning of the year. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
